review text:
Healed my child's eczema in combination with the other aveeno products - cleansing therapy, lavender bath, and balm.

Note: If severe eczema, would recommend the balm over this product. Worth the money. The balm provides a thicker moisturizer. This cream is great for maintaining healthy skin or treating mild eczema.

review name: Is not even close to the nighttime balm
review text: We have a two year old that has pretty persistent eczema and has since about a month old. We‚Äôve use the Aveeno Eczema Nighttime Balm for almost a year with a lot of success. She went to bed scratching worse, and when she woke up, her back was covered in a dry, scaly rash. We continued to use this over the next couple of days with it continuing to worsen. review name: If this doesn‚Äôt work for you try....
review text: My boyfriend didn‚Äôt like this for his eczema... instead we got the walmart brand one in very similar packaging and he loves that one! Everyone reacts differently I suppose. I‚Äôm not sure what is different between the two because they appear to almost be the exact same product

Amazing product! I used aquaphor for years with ok results but this winter my eczema got out of control, it was so bad on my hands! Within 1 day there was huge improvement and now day 3 my terrible spots are almost gone! Incredible! Highly recommended!

I've had severe eczema since I was a kid and while it's subsided in my adult years I still get itchiness and dryness on my hands a lot and sometimes on my stomach and thighs. This stuff does about a half job for me... I'm less dry and less itchy but it's not like it goes away. I'd say if you have moderate or mild eczema this will help you, but if your eczema is severe or you've had it a very long time, either try another product or go ask a doctor for something prescription. On the plus side, this stuff applies easily and doesn't make me feel sticky or gross like some other lotions do.

My favorite lotion of all time. It has no detectable scent whatsoever. I have eczema on my face, neck, and arms and this lotion is sensitive enough for me to use as a face lotion. A lot of other lotions made for eczema irritate my skin and make me scratch even worse but this is the lotion I always come back to. It soaks into skin fast and doesn‚Äôt leave a greasy layer like some other lotions. I don‚Äôt use this on my entire body but I do use daily on my face and arms but a tube of this will still last me around 5 months.
I have rosacea plus flaky skin on my face. This is the only lotion I have found that helps. It‚Äôs a must have for me.

It is the best for eczema. I recommend it for all my patients (I am Pediatric Nurse Practitioner) for eczema and all three of my girls have eczema and it is the ONLY moisturizer that works for all 3 of them. With this we significantly cut down on the steroid use for eczema!!

review name: No more dry, itchy, inflammated skin!!
review text: I have very dry, sensitive, and itchy skin and this just works! I bought the Eucerin version as well to see which would work better, but Aveeno is superior by far. I developed eczema on my hand about a year ago and recently started using the Aveeno Eczema Therapy. The smell is not so great, but it has really helped my skin get better than anything other lotions I've tried.

My dermatologist recommended that I use this lotion on my ankles and lower calves to reduct itching. For a product listing oatmeal as the active ingredient (and not chemicals), it really works and is very inexpensive in Amazon. Nice to have a lotion that is natural. Highly recommended!

I don‚Äôt write reviews often but WOW this seriously worked wonders for my skin, all in less than a week! Dealing w eczema that runs in the family is such a pain when it starts acting up and can be embarrassing when visible but this really actually works i could honestly cry I am SO glad i bought this.

review name: Ok if you have light skin problems and don‚Äôt care the smell

I had eczema all over my legs and arms. I could not shave because I would cut myself everywhere my eczema was. I tried steroid creams prescribed from a skin specialist but it was spot treatment and it was too much. So I saw this and tried it. Within a couple days my eczema was gone! I absolutely love this product. I will only ever buy this because it works.

I have bad eczema on my legs. This product works very well. I have been using it once or twice a day and have seen a great improvement! Better than prescription eczema treatments I have tried and it‚Äôs much more natural.

This isn't perfect for me, but so far it's the best one I've tried. The cream is such a thick substance that it's like adding another layer to your skin. It's quite something. It helps reduce the itching sensation I get which is what I want. It typically last for several hours and then I need to apply it again.

review name: This is a must for any little ones that have eczema
review text: My son started showing signs of eczema when he was only a few weeks old. I purchased many different products, but this one made all the difference in the world. We are never without and we always keep a back up as well. We have been using it for almost 5 years now, and his skin is SO soft and healthy. (We also use the Aveeno creamy bathwash.) I 100% recommend this!!!

I had a pretty bad eczema outbreak on my lower neck last night. I treated it with some lotion but I still woke up with my neck extremely try and itchy. Luckily, this balm was delivered this afternoon, so I used it this after noon, and almost all my symptoms seems to be relived within a few hours! BEST Eczema treatment ever! Highly recommanded!

I like how this cream goes on easily and it calms my winter skin itch. No greasy heavy feeling when applying. Pretty much scentless & colorless.
Large container about half the price than the same one at Walgreens.
I highly recommend it.

review name: IMPORTANT INFORMATION FOR PEOPLE WITH PC
review text:
Love this!
I suffer from Pachyonychia Congenita (PC). I'll explain what that means at the bottom. But for those of us who have it find it impossible to find anything that helps.
Y'all, this isn't a cure but it works better than anything else I've tried. (Actually, nothing has ever made a difference.) my hands are much less dry. I haven't used it on my feet but maybe I will to see if it helps. You know you just have dry skin in general, right? Well this takes away the "in general" part. It feels almost rubbery for a few minutes but then that goes away and it feels like nothing.

As for eczema : you have to use it regularly, but it does work. I use it on my face and one spot on my forehead vanished completely and the rest around my nose/mouth/chin is better but it comes back if I don't use it.

People wondering if they have Pachyonychia Congenita (PC) or just curious about what it is:
It's a gene mutation that is found in one of the keratin genes KRT6A, KRT6B, KRT6C, KRT16 or KRT17. It's thought that less than a thousand people in the WORLD have it, but I think it's much more common- just undiagnosed. Basically our bodies produce too much keratin, but our skin cells are also extremely delicate. The result? Our skin cells easily burst and release all that keratin which turns into calluses and blisters. I don't know ALL the details and I'm not sure which I have yet. I'm waiting on test results. In MY case it affects my hands and feet the most. Some have it worse than I do and some have their nails affected causing super thick nails. Others have a folical thing, but I don't know anything about that. No doctor could tell me what was wrong. I was 33 when I happened upon a YouTube video with my symptoms! So I hope my post helps someone figure out what they have and understand there is no magical product or medicine that can cure you. Most products make it worse. Chemicals are horrible! Certain fabrics are the devil. Most people assume calluses help you not feel pain when you walk. That is a myth. Omg the smallest pebble hurts. Stepping on a vacuum cord practically brings me to my knees. I can't walk without socks, it's too painful and if I try to walk on tile or anything other than carpet I slip. The calluses are so hard and thick they slide on the floor! This is embarrassing and painful. It's splits open and creates these papercut like wounds. Chlorine makes it worse. The beach salt makes it worse. (Not to mention you don't want people to see!) cleaners make it worse and can actually cause a very painful inflammation on your hands that eventually dries out really bad, cracks and hurts and itches. Antibacterial soap can cause this. Do not even think about working with cement or clay (no pottery classes) or glues or paints.... My point? This severely hinders your life in ways most people cannot imagine. Do not make fun of people for their flaws. You have no idea the impact it has on their life and often they have no control over it. I can't just "use some lotion" and have soft hands like you. A lot of lotions actually make my hands and feet more dry. The same can be said for anyone suffering from any chronic problems.

review name: Give this product a try!!! It may be the solution you are looking for!
review text: I love this product! During the summer after my first year of college, I noticed that I had a habit of washing my hands too often during the day. I noticed that because I lived in the dorm for my first year of college, I've developed a germ issue (not the extent of OCD or germophobia, but I washed my hands all the time), which really made my hands dry and irritated. I woke up one morning and there was a distinct, different kind of rash I had on my pinky finger. At first I thought it was just a rash and because I'm someone who had rashes due to dry skin since I was a kid, I thought it was the same type of rash. However, it never went away. After dealing with it for two years, it was still there and it developed into a rash with blisters that would crust and sometimes bleed. It also spread, which is something that never happened to me before. My esteem has never been so low and it was embarrassing and uncomfortable to me since it was on my right hand. I went to the doctor and she told me I had some type of dermatitis, specifically contact dermatitis which is an inflammation on the skin to some allergy that I might have. She said to find out what is causing my skin flare and to stop touching it. She gave me a mild ointment to use to ease the itch. She also told me to use a good lotion of my hands since she noticed that they were a bit dry. I went home and tried to figure out everything that might be causing this, from subway poles to the knives handles, but nothing. As time went on, it also got worst. I was in Rite Aid one day and spotted this lotion and I said to myself, what if it's eczema after all it presented all the symptoms and I bought it on a whim despite the price tag. I decided that if it doesn't work, I can always use this as hand/body lotion. I applied it every night and after a couple of months, whatever that was on my hand is 80%-85% gone. I wish I remembered when I started using this to track my progress, but it was definitely not overnight for me, which shows you what kind of dermatitis I was dealing with. I'm so happy that I found this product and that I decided to make the gamble. It was really one of the best impulse buys of my life. If you have a rash problem, I really recommend this product to try. You've seen how many great reviews this one has so you never know. Good luck.

review name: Not as good as Triple Cream
review text:
It's alright. I have some seriously dry skin on my hand that has migrated around over 7 years from finger tip to the rest of the finger pads to the palm and back of hand. It becomes rough and flaky at the slightest provocation. Touching fabric used to be a nightmare, my skin would catch on everything, and I lost my finger prints for a while. They've come back as my finger tips improve luckily.

This stuff is decent as a stop-gap. It would be better for people who have only moderately dry skin, not eczema. Its main ingredient is water so it absorbs quickly. The problem for me is that even lotions marketed as being for "severely dry and cracked skin" don't help. This stuff is about on that level. It has oats, which are great, and help, but it just doesn't moisturize as well as Triple Cream. On the upside, your hands won't be greasy when you use Aveeno. With Triple Cream, Eucerin and Aquaphor they will be greasy for at least an hour. But that's the only thing that helps my skin :/

I'm going to try the Neosporin Eczema Essentials eventually as well, but I'm not sure how well it will go. Looks like it's about the same as Aveeno.

It's nice that some people apparently have their eczema cured by this stuff. From where I am standing there is no cure. :(

review name: Must buy product for severe itching!
review text: I started developing rashes and red bumps and extreme itching on my lower and side of the abdomens and also on my inner thighs. It got to the point I was waking up in the middle of the night scratching my skin to the point it even bled a little. I tried cetaphil, cortisone, vaseline, and premium triple cream but they didn't do much. They would stop the inflammation at the moment but it would start up again later on. I wasn't sure if it was ezcema, dry skin, or even bed bugs! I did some research online and found out that Aveeno Eczema Therapy Cream had great reviews. I just wanted something else to ease the pain of itching. I was skeptical at first but decided to buy it. I applied large amounts of the cream on the rashes every night after taking a shower. On the first night I used it, I still woke up scratching so I was a bit upset. However, I tried again the following night and the night after and the next thing you know, the itching stopped! There was still redness but I was super relieved the itching disappeared. I have used the product for a good 2 weeks and all the rashes on my skin are completely gone! Thanks aveeno!!

review name: it's not too bad, just a few red patches in the crooks ...
review text:
Typically, I'm way too lazy to write a decent review about anything. But this product made me change my mind and made me want to write one, just to help out my fellow eczema-afflicted people.

I've had eczema for most of my life; it's not too bad, just a few red patches in the crooks of my elbows and legs and some patches on my face. The ones on my face appeared recently in the last couple of years for some reason. I was always self-conscious about the dry, flaky skin on my face--especially beneath my nose and a patch right on my cheek. It looks horrible with makeup on, but I still always carried around some concealer in my purse/backpack because I'd rather have flaky-looking skin instead of bright-red spots that people would always look at and say, "Whoa, what happened to you?" I went through all of the "treatments" for eczema--steroids, hydrocortisone, aloe vera gel, lotions, etc. None of them worked. Sure, my eczema will disappear for a few days, but it always came back. I'm pretty sure my skin developed a tolerance for the stuff.
I wasn't too sold on the idea of a lotion magically helping my eczema, but I saw the reviews for it and decided why the hell not. And I'm glad it did. The first few days, it was a little flaky. However, the redness was gone. By the fourth day, all flakiness on my cheek has disappeared and the area looks just as clear as the rest of my face. It's still a little dry below my nose, but it doesn't look as red as before.

Thank you Aveeno, this really is such a great product. I would be devastated if you were to discontinue it.
Works perfect!

There are still hills and valleys on my skin, but not as pronounced, and I'm not getting any younger either. My atopic dermatitis has improved somewhat in the last few months, but I can't attribute it to just the cream; my condition is also related to stress and allergies. So I recommend this product to others with very dry skin. I bought six tubes from Amazon because the product is not always on the shelves at Walmart or CVS when I need it.

review name: The key is to systemize for everyday eczema life for less stress on mental and physical
review text:
My 9 year old daughter was using Aveeno Ezcema Cream for more than 1 year. Sometimes in combination with steroid/cortisone cream when her skin condition gets worse. However, even with Aveeno cream alone was obviously helping her eczema to be under control(frankly I once thought if this cream contains steroid. I felt this cream worked similar to what steroid does. Works like miracle). We could not live without this cream.

One day after applying out of new package, she started scratching like crazy and ended up having hives. I was wondering why it happens suddenly, why it did not happen until then. Is it because my daughter‚Äôs skin condition then or is it because Aveeno changed the ingredients for the cream? I don‚Äôt know.

OK, now she cannot count on Aveeno Eczema Cream. I had no choice but to search how to fix her eczema or at least to keep her eczema under control without addicting on either steroid or Aveeno Eczema Cream.

I now appreciate this happened. Because her eczema is better now without neither of them. I simply tried the followings.

Changed the diet(Gluten-free, Low carb, Low sugar, Chicken bone soup, etc)
Filtering drinking water
Using laundry detergent to natural
No soap use for body(just rinse w/warm water)
Avoid possible allergens(cat, sun, etc)
Live stress-free
Easy excercise(walking a lot, etc)
Probiotic supplement
Mineral supplement
Unda supplement series

Now I am planning to do ‚ÄúDelayed Allergy Reaction Test‚Äù on her to find out if there is anything(food, mold, etc) that we are not aware and she is reacting to.

Also, knowing the possible causes of eczema such as Leaky gut/Candida overgrowth(GAPS Diet Book explains clearly) helped me open my eyes.

Bottom line. Eczema is terrible to have. I hate it deeply. But she happened to have it and cannot changed the fact. If so, face it and try to study what is really going on the body. Think logically. The key is to systemize for everyday eczema life for less stress on mental and physical.

Hope this helps for those who are struggling.
My 5 month old has eczema and this is the only lotion I have found that completely helps. It's like a miracle cream. I slather it on twice a day and if I forget her eczema starts to come back.

I had eczema over 20 years since teenage. I visited several doctors and used several different prescribed products, it worked for short period of time, it always came back after stopping using them. The latest one was "Protopic" which is powerful and effective, but it doesn't cure the eczema as it also came back. Then I tried something new. Here was I did.
I used "Protopic" for 1-2 weeks and my skin became normal, then continued Protopic for another week, I quickly switched to Aveeno Eczema for about a month, surprisingly, the condition never came back for years. I don't use any lotion for years, but carefully avoid spicy food or anything that could trigger the condition.
Aveeno Eczema may not be strong enough to cure chronic eczema, but strong enough to maintain it as soon as it is diminished from using more powerful medicine.

So I checked the ingredients on the back of the label, and nothing spectacular. Pretty much a recombination of typical Aveeno ingredients.

BUT IT WORKS. I have had eczema for 30 years and tried EVERYTHING - steroid creams (OTC and prescription), immunosuppressant creams, bleach baths, you name it. This works. One week later - red rashes on my hands, neck and face significantly reduced or gone.

One caveat - you have to reapply pretty often during the day (at least I did). That being said, I don't know of a cream that works any other way, so I don't consider this a major drawback. I still have to occasionally use OTC steroid cream, but much less often now (1x/wk v. nearly every day). For people with mild to moderate eczema - 1x after you shower, 1x before bed - should be sufficient.

Both my kids have suffered from eczema and therefore we are always on the market for ointments that would relieve their complaints. Before starting my review about this product in particular, I want to share a few observations about this nasty skin condition:

First of all, the best cure for eczema is time... My older child has almost completely grown out of it by the age of three. Now my younger has a big deal of eczema especially prominent in her right hand fourth finger area. I am pretty optimistic no matter how bad it looks at the moment she will be okay within a year or so. This is what pediatricians agree too.

Second best treatment is unfortunately steroids. They are good at suppressing local inflammation which is the cause of eczema. However they have huge adverse effects ranging from the decline in general immunity to total growth suppression and psychiatric problems. Many experts claim that topical administration is innocent but I never feel comfortable so those are out of consideration for me. I can't live with the suspicion of doing a general harm to my child while trying to cure a relatively limited problem.

The best you can do is to avoid over washing the area, moisturize as much as possible and be patient...

If we come to this particular item... I have had it over a month now and bought it mostly due to the good reviews in amazon. Another source I checked before clicking the purchase button was EWG (environmental working group), an agency that classifies skin products based on the ingredients and tell you how harmful it is. According to their evaluation this item gets 2/10 ( lower the better) and is considered to be pretty safe for human use. Therefore, despite not believing the magical therapeutic potential, I still decided to give it a go.

After a month of regular use, I have observed ABSOLUTELY NO improvement in my daughter's eczema. I would give it 5 stars even if I saw a slight change but nothing whatsoever. It may be a good general moisturizer and may prevent eczema or other skin conditions if applied routinely but over an existing eczema it has no healing potential. I don't want to generalize and say it won't work for you since that would not be a scientific claim, but based on my experience and other reviewers complaining about the same inadequacy, I can not recommend the cream as a treatment for moderate to severe eczema.

If you want a better shoot for your money, I suggest trying any of the diaper rash creams that has zinc oxide in it as the active ingredient. I have got some success with those despite not having achieved a full recovery yet...
This cream has really helped our family through the winter. Though the eczema isn't completely gone, it is a great moisturizer and prevents itchy rashes!

Hello:
I bought one Aveeno Moisturizing cream (Eczema Therapy) a few days ago. This morning I receive my express from Amazon.
When I open the Aveeno cream,I find mouth of the bottle which had opened WITHOUT sealed tin.
I felt very very worried and uncomfortable.Without sealed tin,how dare I use this to my baby just 13 months?
Why WITHOUT sealed tin ? I bought other types cream of Aveeno which all had the sealed tin.
Please tell me the reason.

I have used Amazon several times and am usually pleased with the products and service. I expected no less from my order, but when I received it, the seal from all four tubes of Aveeno cream were missing, and in its place, there was scotch tape over the cap to "indicate" that it had not been open. It makes me extremely concerned that the products have been tampered with and I refuse to use them, as they are for my two young children, and I do not want to take any chances. If you are considering purchasing this lotion from Amazon, be aware that the product may have been tampered with!

My daughter had been suffering from eyelid eczema for weeks. She is 17 years old and hasn't had an eczema flare since she was about 10 years old. We went to a doctor and to a dermatologist, and they both just readily prescribed steroid-based creams. After reading the horrible side effects, especially when applied on the eyelid, we definitely sought to find a better solution. We tried aquaphor, Vaseline, pure Argan oil (really expensive!), chinese herbal capsules, unrefined shea butter, organic extra virgin coconut oil----nothing worked! Then we found our perfect combination. I knew that her eczema flare was related to her having seasonal allergies, so she started taking Allegra 180 mg. daily and using Aveeno Eczema Therapy moisturizing cream. I read the reviews for this cream and was really impressed. We were so desperate for a healthy solution, that I decided to give it a try. I am sooooo happy that I did. Within 24 hours, I knew that we had stumbled across a winner! Boy, oh boy, what a major difference in her skin. Can you imagine the turmoil in being a 17 year old high school senior with eyelid eczema? She had swollen, red, itchy, crusty, stretched and wrinkled eyelids with undereye dark circles. Not a pretty sight. Within 24 hours-- her red, swollen, wrinkled eyelids returned to normal. She applies the moisturizing cream about 4 times a day and sleeps with a cool mist humidifier at night to keep the air moist. I sure hope this helps someone.

I‚Äôve had very sensitive skin since childhood. This is the best product on the market! I‚Äôve used as a body lotion for a couple of weeks. It works so well that I decided to try it on what appears to be a large rosacea spot on my forehead. Within two days I noticed a remarkable different how smooth and barely noticeable it looks! I‚Äôve tried so many different products including antibiotic lotion, hydrocortisone cream, vitamin C serum, etc. Nothing worked. I now use Aveeno on my entire face. The bumps on my legs have disappeared too! Thank you Aveeno!! You are a lifesaver!

I do not have Eczema, but I figured that a cream designed for people with the disease would be extremely hydrating. I must admit that I was expecting a super thick, absorbent cream. While this cream is somewhat absorbent and does hydrate, it is very thin for a cream. It is more like a lotion in my opinion.

With that being said, it is a good cream. I have been applying it to my raw, somewhat bloody and peeling nose (I have been sick for 6 days and blowing my nose like crazy. I have rubbed the skin off in areas and it is bleeding). It does not irritate my sore skin. It also helps to keep it hydrated and looking more normal and less like lizard skin. It is soothing. Will it be enough for someone with Eczema? Probably. However, I like a thicker cream when I am looking for a super soothing and hydrating cream. If you like a thinner, easy to rub in cream this is a great option.

This balm has been great. Like many, I can no longer use steroidal creams. This balm helps both my psoriasis and eczema. Helps with itch but also helps reduce the inflammed areas. Upper body. Lower body. Sensitive areas. This stuff helps all over. At this price, It's easily worth a shot if you've been looking for something that actually helps. I'd be crushed if they stopped making this stuff. It's not a quick fix. It's something you can use over time as needed. I've been using it for over a year. Good luck!

review name: Calmed down my intense flare up almost immediately
review text: I just purchased this cream in a fit of desperation. The eczema on my hands/inbetween my fingers was filling with fluid (if you have it, you know what I mean) and was itching like crazy. Like I was shivering it itched so much. I then came in contact with a dog which I was allergic to and the patches I usually get on the inside of my arm were HUGE and soooo itchy. I applied some aquaphor and that made it so much worse. I also broke out even more on my whole chest which I never get, but had that day even before the dog. I drove to the pharmacy for some benadryl which I never take because I don't want to rely on it, but it was just so bad that I needed it. If anything, my prescribed steroid cream was making the itching and bumps worse. As I was walking in I saw this product and even though it was somewhat pricey, I had a coupon and grabbed it. I applied it immediately and the itching stopped. The swelling went down. My hands stayed moisturized for hours. It was absolutely amazing. It didn't completely go away, but my chest calmed down so that people were no longer looking at me and asking what was wrong. The hives went away. Usually when I apply lotion to my hot spots it makes it even more itchy but this stuff was so soothing. I didn't give it 5 stars because obviously it didn't cure my eczema, but its hands down the best cream I've used

review name: A must try product...Lifesaver for my daughter's eczema.
review text: I can't say enough about this product.my 4 yr old had very bad eczema on her legs and thighs.I kept applying cetaphil and aquaphor seeing no change in her skin's condition.in January it got worse and very red.i tried to give this a shot .first day she complained little burning when I applied Aveeno , after 10 days my daughters legs are smooth as never before.This is the first product that ever worked for her legs ECZEMA.I get lazy to write reviews but wanted to share as this product is just AMAZING.

The Aveeno Eczema Therapy Moisturizing Cream For Sensitive Skin is great for my skin. It offers a perfect combination of a silky, smooth cream but a bit more heavy and enriching like a healing ointment. It absorbs nicely but does not wear off too quickly. I've had eczema for years on my hands, arms, torso and legs and this really helps keep it at bay. It is also great for general dry, winter skin. Super hydrating. I like that it is steroid and fragrance free so I can use it as often as needed as opposed to the prescription steroids I've used in the past. I also use it on my toddlers after bath time and during winter when their skin tends to be more dry. This is a great product. I highly recommend it.

First of all, it absolutley breaks my heart to read the reviews where this product did not help. From the first time I used it I saw a huge difference. I have been plagued by two extremely dry, incredibly itchy, red and peeling patches of skin for over two years. I did use Cetaphil Restoraderm and thought it was very good. When I got down to the bottom of the bottle I decided to look around for another product since even though it helped more than other products I had used, I still had the problem. After reading the reviews on Amazon (everybody please take time to write reviews because believe me they are read and relied upon in making product purchases!) I was very impressed even though there were a number of negative reviews, as well. Again, the first time I used it there was a noticeable difference in the amount of dryness even though the area was still pretty red. I expected that though. I used it both morning after a shower and at night. I have used it even a couple of times during the day when I had time. It has only been a couple of weeks and the dryness is considerably better and the skin softer and definitely smoother. Since my skin stays soft the itching has diminished greatly. I cannot recommend this product enough simply because it works. I notice the redness is much less and what is to me the most compelling reason to try it, is that my skin is getting better and better each and every day to the point where it is FINALLY clearing up after suffering with that horrible itch day in and day out for so long. As many of you know, who can sleep when you are so uncomfortable! Now saying all that I really do not like to use any chemicals - especially petroleum - however, I was considering using a cortisone cream and thought this was the lesser of the two 'evils'. I am glad I did since it really is clearing up and I will not have to use it ongoing. I intend to switch at some point to a much more natural alternative, but for now it is doing the job beautifully! Blessings to all!! P.S. changing the diet and eliminating sugar, white flour, dairy and drinking pure water will do wonders, too!

I've had eczema on my hands for the last nine years or so, with it spreading further up my arms in the last couple of years. For some reason, my eczema tends to flare up in the summer months rather than the winter months, which has baffled every dermatologist I've seen. Last summer was particularly brutal. Just taking a shower was torture for my hands, and my doctor-prescribed steroid cream was drying my skin out so badly that none of the other recommended lotions could keep up. I ordered this off of Amazon, and was in love from the very first application! I had previously been using a hydrocortisone lotion that claimed to be "intensively healing" to eczematous skin, but my hands would continue to burn for up to 20 minutes after applying it, and it really didn't seem to keep my hands moisturized like it claimed it would. This Aveeno cream calmed and soothed my skin on contact, and keeps my skin moisturized throughout the day. Within a couple of days, I noticed my skin was starting to heal and my months-long flare up was starting to diminish. I would even recommend this to people without eczema who may just have extremely dry skin. Because it's a cream and not a lotion, it doesn't evaporate from the skin as quickly and actually has a chance to do its job. Because eczema can't be cured, I hope this is a product that remains for years to come. I don't know where I would be without it! Probably contemplating the amputation of my own hands...haha.

My 2 year old suffers from eczema she has super dry skin, redness and dry patches. My 2 year old suffers doctor recommend this product and the Eczema therapy bath wash as well. This product is very thick and creamy. It will leave your little ones skin super hydrated and smooth. I use this product on my little on 4 times a day to notice a difference in my little ones skin and I have. But I don't only use this. When taking my little one a bath I use a lot of different products plus this! I use coconut oil before I put my little one to take a bath. Remember letting your little one play in the bath will dry out their skin causing more dryness, redness and even itchiness to the skin. Putting coconut oil onto your Little ones skin before bath will reduce the chance of making their skin dry. I also use homemade bath bombs fragrance feel. Bath bombs have baking soda which is good for the skin. Baking soda will leave your kids skin hydrated and fresh. I also use homemade bath melts. It's very simply and easy to make and this will help your little ones skin stay free of dryness, redness and itchiness.

I bought this for the treatment of eczema on hands. It felt very greasy and stung, although the label specifically says "non-greasy". So, it is being returned. I do like that there did not seem to be any fragrance, which is often a problem for me with cosmetic products. Additionally, while I like that it is in a container that you can get all of the product out, I don't like having to stick fingers in any product and would prefer a lid with pump that could be removed when it is time to get the last bits of the product out.

Not sure how this "balm" which feels like goopy petroleum jelly, sticks to your clothes, and makes you itch even more is supposed to help. Love the Aveeno eczema with oatmeal for bath and other bath products by Aveeno. But this stuff was a huge disappointment. Going back to CeraVe.

When I have a major flare up, Aveeno eczema products is my go to products before steroid ointments, injections, and pills. Tried store brand versions but they have not been as effective. I never travel without it and keep a supply at home and in my RV. Nothing over the counter provides relief from the itch and pain like Aveeno.

So. I don't know if I can stop singing praises for this cream. I wish I bought it from Amazon (and I will, in the future), because it's much cheaper than buying it at other retailers. Yay!

But seriously. My hands have been plagued with contact dermatitis for the last three years. Probably the result of how often I washed dishes and washed my hands (I'm sure it happens to all dog owners - do something for your dog and you inevitably find your hand covered in slobbery kisses), as well as other cleaning agents my hands have come in contact with. Cracking skin, bleeding wounds - you name it. I couldn't even touch hydrogen peroxide, because it would work its way under and my entire hand would become white and numb!

My doctor prescribed fluocinonide, which helped a little bit, but was expensive for less than 4 oz. But this Aveeno Eczema cream has done wonders - in a matter of two days, my hands felt softer, the cracking diminished so much that I could hardly see it! It did what my prescribed ointment took 3 weeks to do, in a matter of days. I seriously recommend this product if you find yourself with contact dermatitis - it's worth a shot before shelling out the big bucks for prescribed ointments.

review name: Aveeno has improved - this is very good
review text:
Our six year old and I both have eczema/atopic skin, and this lotion offers good relief. It absorbs well in the skin, and does not have any oily, greasy feel to it. No odor either. Good for both adults and kids. We haven't tried to "cure" eczema patches with it, but it has worked pretty well on a preventive basis as patches have been occurring less often.

We used Aveeno products about five years ago but stopped because were weren't impressed. This is better and we will be more ope to other Aveeno products after this good experience.

I love this product!! My son is 10 months old and barely started getting these dry patches of skin on his back and face. I went to buy this with no knowledge of how well it actually worked, but it's amazing! A little bit of product goes a long way. It's very thick cream so you don't need much. It's also a very big jar of product so I'm sure it'll last me awhile. I put the cream on my son throughout the day and immediately after his nightly bath. His patches are not as dry and it does a great job at keeping his skin moisturized. I will be buying this again!

review name: Why I choose Aveeno for Eczema treatment over Gold Bond and CeraVe
review text: I have a 5 month old son that needed an eczema cream, as do I. So, I have used three eczema creams now. I tried this cream first and liked it. It was a cream that I purchased before he was born and I am so glad that I did. His pediatrician said that eczema can run in families. So if this condition runs in your family and you're expecting a baby, you might consider getting some of this cream to have on hand. I also tried CeraVe but ti did not feel as silky as the Aveeno cream. I also tried Gold Bond Ultimate eczema relief cream. While Gold Bond is usually my favorite brand over perfumed products due to having sensitive skin, I thought this particular cream felt "thinner" than the Aveeno. And, that is why I choose Aveeno Eczema Therapy Moisturizing Cream.

I only bought it to relieve the dryness of my eczema, but it's gone above and beyond! And now my eczema is actually healing. I've had eczema on my hands since high school (6 years ago) and nothing really worked, not even the corticosteroid creams from the dermatologists. I tried vaseline and honey for a while, but even those didn't help. I kinda gave up and just accepted eczema as a part of my life and was looking for some lotion to relieve the intense dryness and pain I was having. Once I put it on, my hands felt so much better almost instantly. The actual healing process took a few days to start, but the results have been amazing nonetheless. Now I just want to jump for joy and tell everyone about it. It really gave me hope when I had none left.

I‚Äôve had eczema since I was a kid and I have tried SO many different products.. I had prescribed lotion but could no longer get it so I had to try over the counter stuff. I‚Äôve tried a couple different kinds that didn‚Äôt work until I read the reviews on this cream and decided to give it a try. ITS A MIRACLE WORKER! I would stay up at night itching till I would bleed... my hands would be so cracked, dry and broke opened that it hurt to actually bend my hands.. my arms world be so red and rashed that it was embarrassing to wear short sleeve shirts.. I‚Äôve had this lotion for a week and already by skin looks back it it‚Äôs normal tone.. and hardly any red spots.. I am amazed with how wonderful this product works and for the price it wasn‚Äôt bad. Thank you Aveeno for making such an awesome product!!

Around 6 1/2-7m old my baby started developing patches of dry skin near her fingers and on her cheeks and nose. Later it spread to her arms, shoulders, thighs, back of legs and really bad on her back. Her skin felt dry and scaly and some areas red. I started getting worried because nothing was helping. First I tried natural remedies. I tried coconut oil which I applied many times a day, a homemade shea butter recipe, a homemade aloe vera/shea butter lotion (which cause her skin to become super red where I applied it), lanolin and tried blending up some oatmeal for her bath. Those didn't work so gave into trying vaseline and Aquaphor which her doctor had recommended. None of this even touched it really. I found this cream while cleaning my older daughter's room (she had mild eczema as a toddler) and decided it wouldn't hurt to try it. I put it on that night and when baby woke up her dry patches were 80% gone. Day 2 and they're completely gone. I honestly can't believe it. She's so much happier too! Poor little thing! I hate paying $7-10 for a lotion, but when it actually works I'll pay it.

My kids both get extremely dry skin during our Minnesota winters, and as a teacher who washes her hands 12-20 times a day we just can‚Äôt live without this! Amazingly soothing and restorative Aveeno is one of the two lotions that my hypersensitive-skin daughter can use without breaking out or itching. I like that there isn‚Äôt a strong odor or greasy feel to it. If you need a restorative lotion for skin (smespecislly elbows and knees) give this one a try.

Tried this on my 2 year old after using Aveeno Daily Moisturizing. Within seconds he was screaming and in distress. Immediately noticed a bumpy, red rash everywhere I put it on his chest and sides. It was scary. Tried it on myself with no reaction. For reference, the expiration date on my bottle is 03/2022 and lot 1000LZ/2. Be sure to try a test patch on your child before using heavily. My son hasn't had a reaction to any other skin product.

I just bought this product a few days ago and WOW, am I glad! I have a skin allergy to sulfates (lathering agent in soaps), and I was suffering on a daily basis every time I washed my hands. review text: I've had chronic eczema all my life, but for the past year or so it has only been affecting my hands. No combination of lotions, gloves, or other precautions has made any difference. I've just been treated for actinic keratoses on my hands and arms, a pre-courser to melanomas. The treatment left my hands and arms looking terrible, with deep red, rough, itchy splotches and after the initial treatment I used, as prescribed, cortisone 3 x daily for a proscribed period. I then moved on to moisturizers, which did very little. Until I tried the Aveeno eczema cream as a last resort. I'm guessing it's the oats because the other Aveeno cream I had didn't help, it has another primary product in it and is much less effective. The itching abated quickly and now the redness is rapidly lightening. So while some people may be allergic to the oats, apparently many find it helpful. It's a known anti-inflammatory agent. I wouldn't put down the product as some did, some things just don't work for some people. Also it's very emollient. As for the woman who didn't take her Dr.'s advice on the possible oats allergy and applied it yet again to her baby, hard to believe. Cera-Ve is a good cream, although not for my problem.

My son currently four years old has battled with eczema since he was three months old. I have tried every lotion cream essential oil out there and I could not get it under control. I‚Äôm on my second day now, and will continue to use this cream on my eyes throughout the winter and my pregnancy! Would give it more stars if I could!

This is the single best lotion I‚Äôve ever bought. I have type 1 diabetes and eczema, which is a recipe for terribly dry skin. I bought this thinking that it may work and it may not, but it‚Äôs cheaper than many other brands‚Äô eczema lotions, so I‚Äôd try it out. I have a prescription topical steroid that I use when it starts getting cold out and that‚Äôs normally the only way my skin keeps from drying out and cracking. It‚Äôs been three days that I‚Äôve been using this stuff and I don‚Äôt even have to use the steroid anymore! I put it on at night when I go to bed, and my hands feel great the entire next day. I had been using Benadryl and cortisone cr√®me. Although those work somewhat, this stuff works much much better. This cr√®me contains oatmeal. Turns out that scientific studies have shown that that oatmeal has compounds known as avenanthramides that have antihistamine, anti-inflammatory and protective properties for the skin. All I know is that for me it has been a miracle cure. I rub it onto my skin after I shower and my skin is still wet. I highly recommend this product.

applied to irritated areas of the skin. cream only enhanced my eczema and made it 100x more red & painful. it does very little to moisturize the skin. my skin feels soft, but it feels like i‚Äôm applying lava. skin dries out after short time after use. personally would not recommend this product to anyone. i tried the product many times to give the benefit of the doubt, but currently i‚Äôm feeling like my skin is burning off as i type this review. i wish you all luck on finding the right product for you <3

review name: We used it in winter when my kids have really dry skin and it works well without leaving a greasy feeling or wet feeling which t

Coming from someone who has truly tried everything under the sun on her face, this is worth a shot (but a little goes a long way)!

review name: Great for our 3 year old son!
review text:
My three year old son has pretty bad eczema on his left leg. It's scaly, itchy, and we can't get him to stop scratching. My mother came down to visit and said that this cream had helped her eczema and that we might want to give it a whirl. Immediately, Kent stopped scratching. It doesn't have a scent, and it's mildly oily. It's not quite as smooth as regular lotion, but it doesn't feel harsh. I thought there's no way this stuff could really be doing anything. A day later, I didn't really anything different on Kent's leg. But we kept applying it, anyway. About a week later the eczema was essentially gone. Only a few little spots were visible. Woo hoo! Once he was "cured," we got out of the habit of applying the lotion, and his eczema returned. We just started using the lotion again, and it's beginning to vanish. In other words, I have no doubts that it's the cream that's working. The bottle says it's safe enough for a baby, and I believe it. It doesn't bother our son at all, and I'm a little relieved that it doesn't have any of those obnoxious scents. A little lotion goes a long way. We've used this lotion for about 3 weeks and we can hardly tell it's been depleted at all.

Yes, it is expensive for a bottle of lotion (we bought it for $12 at CVS), but worth it. If you give it a try, be sure to reserve judgement at least a week. The change is slight the first few days, but noticeable given some time. Also, you can save some cash if you decide to subscribe to it, and I can't brag enough about Amazon subscriptions. My wife and I use subscriptions for toilet paper, paper towels and diapers and save more than even Sam's Club bulk prices on many things (diapers are much cheaper, but Zip Locs are cheaper at Sam's...do your homework to make sure a subscription pays for you). For this lotion, the subscription price makes sense. Unless you've got more than one eczema sufferer, I can't imagine going through one bottle in less than three months, and at $9, the cost of this lotion is negligible. Three bucks a month to wave goodbye to eczema? That's a no-brainer.

review name: A little pricey but that means it works!! Ha!

review text: Let me tell you that this is the FIRST time I've had to deal with eczema, BUT had a horrible flare up on my neck/upper chest since St. Patty's Day - OVER 2 MONTHS! It looked horrible. Well, lets just say that it did burn a bit initially (duh, what you'd expect if my skin was irritated and raw??) but today, Sunday May 22nd - only 3 days after initial application, my nasty rash DISAPPEARED, as if nothing was there. I did truly think I was scarred for life. I will definately continue to use this cream well after the fact, as I never want to endure that burning/itching/scratchy feeling EVER AGAIN! Just be patient and believe me its well worth the $12 I paid for it (already spent hundreds buying other useless stuff).

I would highly recommend this cream. The bottle makes it easy to dispense, and the thickness of the cream soaks into the skin. It says it's fragrance-free, and it is. It's a great product and it works.

review name: So Good I'm Writing My First Review
review text: I don't think I've ever posted a review of a product but had to share our great experience with this one. Our daughter has had eczema on her back, hips and arms since she was 4 months old (she's 14 months now). The pediatrician recommended Aquaphor (esp after bath to lock in water) or CeraVe. I didn't see any improvement from the Aquaphor and the CeraVe seemed to keep things from getting worse but didn't really make them better. My mom bought this when I was away and when I returned 3 days later our daughter's back was soft, smooth and clear. She's just learned to say "itch" and she will crawl over to the changing station and pull this down when the patches on her hips flare up. It's amazing. Highly recommended.

review name: my hands actually look and feel better. I highly recommend this product to any nurse ...
review text: I am a nurse and I do not have eczema. I have dry, inflamed, itchy skin from constantly washing my hands. I did not want a steroid cream so I bought this product on a whim about a week ago. I have used it every day for the past 7 days and my hands, that have been constantly dry, red, and itching for months, are almost back to normal! I really put this product to the test after working 3 days in a row (after 3 shifts my hands are usually at their worst). At the end of the 3rd shift, my hands actually look and feel better. I highly recommend this product to any nurse who is looking for an alternative to a prescription steroid cream.

Highly recommend this cream for all types of eczema. Tried a few creams and this was the only one that was able to clear up some stubborn eczema in regions prone to sweat. If you're looking for a gentle and effective eczema cream, this is the one for you!

review name: Wprks wonders on my sons eczema
review text: My son has suffered from eczema from the time he was a baby. He is usuallly covered in sores. After searching and searching for something besides steriod cream that will not burn his skin I have finally found a cure. I have to be consistent about putting the lotion on or it comes right back. Some of the reviewers have complained about the price but to end his suffering I think it is a small price to pay. Thank you Aveeno.

Nothing fancy, does not work wonders for my eczema. I had atopic eczema for years and this cream did nothing to help. Sure, it is really gentle and non irritating, but the moisturizing effected not that long lasting. It was alright for by hands but very unsuitable for my face! When I had flare ups, I applied this, and it did not soothe my skin and it felt sticky and my face don't seem to absorb this well! When I leave it on my red, rough eczema patches on my face, it seem to stay on my face and I notice white flakes of the oil forming.. In conclusion, this lotion is not as good as it claims, neither did it heal or soothe the redness and it certainly did not help prevent flare ups for my eczema. I don't recommend this for atopic eczema sufferers, but if you have mild eczema it may work.

UPDATE: I was wrong about this lotion. It is a very nice thick lotion, but I didn't realize it was an oral medication my doctor had me on that took care of the eczema and not this lotion. However it is a nice lotion that does soothe, but it will not get rid of eczema (at least in my case).
----------------------
I have had eczema for most of my life and except for a bad case as a child, it has been mild, but constant for 30 years. My most recent case was a strip on the back of my knee that was about an inch long and half inch wide that felt and looked like tough old red leather. I have had it for months and using another product, it would not go away.

After two days of using the Aveeno my small strip of eczema is almost gone. Within 12 hours of use it had softened and even began to peel. I love this cream and wish I had discovered it years ago. It is a little pricey, but well worth it. It is far cheaper for me to buy one bottle of the Aveeno than the four or five bottles of another kind that really wasn't working well.

review name: apply once a day and forget about it
review text: I get heat rash and eczema in summer and very dry skin in winter. I could not stand the itchiness. Now I use this and Dove sensitive soap bar year round. I don't use fragrances either. review text: Love it! I won't use anything else!

I have had a rash on my cheeks for over 2 years now. I have been to the dermatologist 3 times and was told it was 3 different things including sebborheic dermatitis, rosacea and eczema. I have been prescribed Desonide which I slathered on my face for a year not knowing it is harmful and thins your skin. It helped a little, but never made it go away. It also left my cheeks looking weird, pink and like a layer of skin had been removed. I finally went to another dermatologist and was prescribed Ketaconazole and Hydrocortizone (at least this time I was told not to keep using the steroid cream). Every time I used the Ketaconazole, the rash became even worse. The Hydrocortizone helped, but only if I continually used it. As soon as I stopped, it would come right back. This did not help as you're not supposed to keep using it! The third dermatologist prescribed a heavy duty antibiotic, Doxycycline, which made me so nauseous I had to quit taking it. He also prescribed Sulfacetamide which made my cheeks super dry. When I consulted him again, he called in a prescription for Protopic. After reading that it has a black label from the FDA for causing cancer, I never even picked it up. I'm glad I found out BEFORE I wasted my money on it! I have also tried other remedies on my own, which include Derm Essentials, Cetophil cream, Organic Virgin Coconut Oil (which really inflamed my skin), Dandruff shampoo, and Aquaphor. I used to have really nice skin and this rash was driving me crazy.

I came across this cream and thought, what the heck. I have now been using it for 5 days and my face looks better than it has in years. It is really unbelievable to me how well this has worked. As I am writing this, my cheeks are still slightly pink, but the rash is gone and they feel moisturized, not dry. Also, instead of looking like a layer of skin has been removed, it looks like my skin is almost completely healed. I am extremely hopeful that in a couple of weeks, my cheeks will look completely normal again. One thing I do want to mention is sometimes after I put it on and it soaks in, it stings slightly. I wasn't expecting that and was afraid it was going to make it worse, but it continually looked better, not worse. This stuff has been a miracle for me!

I also applied the eczema cream whenever my eczema started itching. I feel as though this cream is one of the best products I have found to help my eczema. The only reason I gave it three stars is because it does not actually get rid of my eczema; however, I do think it is helpful.

He rubs Vaseline on his irritated spots before bed and that works for him. My oldest was on a prescribed lotion for his eczema. This lotion has changed my life. I used to have horrible problems with the skin on my hands, particularly during the winter. It almost looked as if I wore red gloves because there was an actually line on my wrist where the red skin stopped and my regular skin color had stayed intact. It was bad enough that I regularly got questions about what was wrong with my hands. I also had rough scaly patches and skin so dry it cracked open. Putting lotion on often burned and caused an instant rash. This lotion works immediately to heal my skin. It only takes a few applications for my skin to return to its normal color. I never get the rough patches on my skin anymore. My skin will still get dry and crack but only when I neglect to use this lotion like I should. The lotion does burn my skin when it is REALLY dry, but, again, this only happens if I neglect to use it every day or two. I usually only need to use it once or twice every day or two, and my skin is fine.

Two years ago, I got a red, itchy dime-sized patch on my finger and went to the dermatologist who prescribed a cortisone cream which worked. This year, the rash reappeared and spread across my right hand. It was incredibly itchy, painful in warm water and I was desperate. My dermatologist told me it was "dermatitis," wasn't sure of the cause and gave me a strong steroid cream. The steroid cream would work for a day, but then all my skin would flake off. I'd stop using it for a day (because my skin was raw and thin) and the rash would come back. After 4 weeks of this, I went for a followup (and after nearly $100 in copays), I decided to give this a shot instead of continuing with a treatment that made me feel uncomfortable (when I'm told to be super careful not to let the steroid cream touch my face or armpits, I couldn't imagine it was that safe for long term use). After day one, I saw improvement. Within a week, the rash is completely gone. I can't recommend this highly enough. I only wish I'd tried this first.

review name: Excellent cream. It gave me an almost instant relief from burning and itching skin
review text:
I developed a blistery rash, which turned into a blotchy reddened and itchy skin. I suffered for 3 weeks before finding this product. The relief was immediate. It gave my dried and hot skin a cooling effect and moistened it enough to stop itching. I felt reborn.
My rash was a contact dermatitis caused by one harsh laundry detergent Surf. It took 3 weeks of suffering to make a connection. Then I rewashed all my clothes and sheets in a new gentle detergent. But by then my poor skin was so irritated that just a gentle touch would send me into itching frenzy.
Thank God for finding Aveeno. It was my savior.

I have had eczema since I was 13 and I am going on 30. In the past 3 years or so it has gotten much worse, spreading to my hands which is very painful and ugly to look at. My PCP and Dermatologist both tried different prescriptions and only one worked in taking away the itch but did not heal the eczema. When I saw Aveeno came out with this, the price was a deterrent but I was willing to try anything... I am so glad I did! For $11 I found a product that has almost completely faded all of the spots of eczema and taken away the itch/pain completely. HIGHLY recommended!!!

It's a common story amongst eczema sufferers, you've tried all the ointments, creams and lotions out there but none of it seems to help or even makes it worse. I know it did for me, until I finally realized I am sensitive to Parabens, a very common preservative in the cosmetics industry. I discovered this when I used Cetraben, a brand that solely contains Paraffin and Parabens. I know for a fact I don't react to Paraffin, using Vaseline every day on my hyper sensitive face, so what else could it be? After having had continuous eczema that wouldn't clear up for 6 months, I started to look at my collection of moisturisers more critically. And what did I find? Every single one of them contained Parabens, except for my trusty old Vaseline. I went to the GP and they prescribed me a huge tub of Hydromol. It wasn't exactely what I was looking for because I already knew that Vaseline helped my skin from getting worse (although not healing it either), Hydromol has become a useful (SLS free) soap substitute in the shower so I can avoid the numerous bottles of body wash my and my parner have collected over the years.
HOWEVER, what I was -really- looking for was a Paraben free cream (not an greasy ointment like Vaseline OR Hydromol. I had to wash my clothes practically every day!), so with that in mind I looked around and found Aveeno's paraben free products. Because this particular product (Eczema Therapy) is not available in the UK, I bought their regular moisturiser which also claimed to be good for eczema. I am a sceptical person and don't easily believe the whole "natural" fad (even though I am inclined to believe Oatmeal DOES help), I was simply trying to get away from any -possible- irritants my skin could overreact to. And behold... it's been my 3rd day of using the cream, I applied it maybe 3-4 times a day and it's clearing up -amazingly-. I never expected this and was more than ready for another disappointment, but this... I can safely say Aveeno has won me over. The only problem is... this small 100ml tube is almost gone already, after a mere 3 days! Being 7 pound per tube, I am not looking forward to shelling out huge amounts of money for this cream. review name: Worked in Derm, tried them ALL, this one is best!
review text: I worked in a dermatology office for 2 years and tried literally every moisturizer in their sample closet. Aveeno Eczema Therapy was hands down my favorite. When your skin is extra dry you want to go for a product labeled "cream" and not "lotion" because cream is stronger, but I find most creams to leave a greasy residue that is hard to rub in. This moisturizer leaves your skin feeling silky without feeling sticky. I use it myself to combat New England dry winter skin, and also to treat my toddler's eczema (it's the only moisturizer we've used on him since he was born). The only downside is the exorbitant price, but you really do get what you pay for. Almost two years later I finally ran out of samples from my old job, but I was happy to pay the price for this product.

review name: Amazing for Healing Hives; Dry Winter Skin
review text: Broke out in hives last week coupled with winter dry skin and needed medicated and more hydrating balms for my arms and legs. I have mature (over 40), sensitive, acne-prone, congestion-prone, combination skin. But it is less oily in the winter. Earlier last week, I had a nasty allergic reaction to something topical and ended up with contact dermatitis that further evolved into hives. Been taking meds for it but the physical hot flares of hives and discomfort on my legs and arms have been a nuance especially when I am sleeping. I will wake to want to scratch at myself. Thankfully, the flares have been pretty mild but they still itch. I bought a slew of different lotions, balms, medicated creams, and ointments and nothing really took the edge off or hydrated as well as this tub of Aveeno Balm. I absolutely love the texture of the balm version of this as it is thick. Not sure what I can liken it to, but it isn't a lotion or like heavy cream. Nor is it like Vaseline or petroleum. I appreciate glycerine being the first ingredient over water. The slip of this is dense but the application goes on smoothly and is very soothing. I've only used it a couple of times in the last 24 hours since it arrived and it has made a significant difference in my skin. I will be getting this and having it on hand from now on, especially in the winter when the air, and consequently my skin, is drier. It is extremely effective and still gentle. It will absorb into the skin, but I layered it on kinda thick so I had a hint of residue when I went to bed. But I didn't rouse to mindlessly clawing at my legs, so there is that. Who knew oats and glycerine were so healing? I mean, I did but had no idea it would be this nice. It does have a scent, not added. I believe it comes from the oats, which isn't unpleasant or medicinal. Just bland, which is fine with me. I think this would be suitable for use on both body and face, as needed. Affordable. No frills. Effective.

review name: High hopes, but way too heavy and greasy for my sensitive skin.
review text:
I bought this with high hopes as all this excessive hand washing was really doing a number on my hands and triggering Eczema flare-ups. I was hoping that this would help soothe my hands, but also work for general dry skin woes that I have.

Unfortunately this product is just not for me and my sensitive skin. While my skin is dry, eczema prone and apt for anger, I also find that heavy products make me feel so so so uncomfortable. This balm honestly feels like a glorified vaseline, but way way thicker and clearly far more expensive. Prior to purchase I was optimistic and thought it seemed like a good value, but after trying it out, those thoughts are long gone. This stuff just sat on my skin making it greasier and angrier and I honestly couldn't wait to get it off. It didn't feel like it was moisturizing my skin at all, which I expected given that it had ingredients like ceramides in it. It's also listed as being non-greasy, which I have to say is 1000% not the case. The tub has a cover on it initially and it was also pretty messy to contend with.

It did nothing for my flare-ups and zero for my dry skin. Perhaps if it had, I might have been able to somewhat look past the way it felt. But no, we were 0-2 here and paired with the price, I just can't recommend this. Judging by the reviews, it clearly is a winner for so many, but if you have quite sensitive, dry skin and you don't like heavy/greasy products, I'd suggest that you look elsewhere.

On a general note, I think this might be the last time I try a product from this brand. I've tried numerous Aveeno products over the years and sadly, most of them have caused negative reactions or simply didn't work for me (their hair line was a nightmare for me). They're clearly quite popular, I guess they're just not for me and my skin!

If this review was helpful, please mark it 'helpful'! Thanks! :)

I WISH I found this a year ago!! The skin on my index and middle fingers on my right hand, out of nowhere, began peeling and cracking to the point of bleeding last year. It was really painful and didn‚Äôt stop.

I‚Äôve probably spend upwards of $150...and truly nothing worked. I bought the moisturizing gloves, o‚Äôkeefes working hands, literally ALL of the bath and body works hand lotions, neutrogena Norwegian hand cream, Vaseline, puriya wonder balm, steroid cream... i even tried straight olive oil on my hands. That‚Äôs just what I remember off the top of my head. I resorted to using cuticle clippers to clip off the peeling or cracked skin when it would start to fall off or bleed before it would start to catch on things, that‚Äôs how bad it was.

On a whim, I saw this. I figured worse case scenario, I‚Äôve wasted another $7 on something else that doesn‚Äôt work. MY GOD I WAS WRONG. IT IS MIRACULOUS. Within a week, MY HANDS ARE NORMAL. all the peeling skin and cracks are literally gone. They‚Äôre normal hands again!! My friends and family even commented on how much better they look. Within ONE WEEK...it was better. It‚Äôs been about a month, and it‚Äôs still maintaining.

As for the lotion itself, it‚Äôs pretty thick, but not overly greasy. I did notice if you apply too much, it can make your hands almost feel dirty if that makes any sense. I have to be careful not to overapply, or I end up having clammy hands. It doesn‚Äôt have any scent at all that I notice, which I appreciate so I can wear perfume without it clashing.

I will never NOT have a stock pile of this lotion as long as I live!

review name: Surprised how well this works for eczema on hands
review text:
Been dealing with exzema on hands for about 2 years. I've used steroidal creams to clear it temporarily, but it always comes back. I've used a bunch of moisturizers, and some are OK (O'Keeef's Working Hands, or other stuff with colloidal oatmeal), but none really keep the flaky, raw, red eczema down as well as this stuff. I can put it on and it lasts for a while, and keeps my hands looking basically normal (except for redness). Other moisturizers will work for a very short time, or just not really address the flaking and rawness.

Overall I am super happy I found this stuff. It's making it a lot easier to deal with eczema, making it less uncomfortable, and also letting me be less anxious about it. My hands can look really unappealing when they're super rashy, and it's a little embarrassing, but this cream addresses the rash to a point where I don't really have to worry about it. I apply it through the day and eczema is kept really well at bay.

I just wish there was a smaller size available, the 7.3oz tube is too large to be convenient at all times.

review name: Miracle for dry, itchy, cracked hands due to cold/dry weather
review text: This is a miracle cream/lotion. I knew several years ago I had issues with my dry and itchy skin during this time of year. As I was on my teenage years, I would apply any lotion and it helped my hands. Eventually, I noticed that my hands would get cracked skin very easily, it was time to spend a few extra dollars so I bought Aveeno lotion for dry skin and that helped and never had issues (my skin got used to the environment I was). Recently and after ten years, my hands began to crack again as I moved to a colder place. The regular Aveeno lotion wouldn‚Äôt help, I went to buy chea and coconut oil based cream and that neither did a thing, then I came to look for something else from Aveeno and came across this lotion, I figured it wouldn‚Äôt hurt to try... I AM GLAD I DID. I noticed the difference since the moment I put this lotion onto my dry, itchy hands. I had cracks on my skin that burned and even would starting to bleed. 3 days after the first application, my hands are 99% healed and I only applied twice a day despite I am constantly washing my hands.

The hardest eczema to control is when I get it around my eyes. I was desperate when an effective eczema moisturizer I had been using was discontinued so I decided to give this a try due to my good experience with Aveeno products not related to eczema in the past. This balm is very effective, soothing, and quick to work. It has the texture of petroleum jelly but your skin will absorb it because it is not as thick. I have extremely sensitive skin and this product does not agitate it at all. The first picture I posted shows a moderate outbreak I had with excessive itchiness and raw skin prompting one of my eyelids to swell slightly. The second was taken only twelve hours later with much improvement and no pain or itch.

We love this stuff and the jar doesn't skimp, you get a full container. I have two daughters 1 and 3 that both have severe eczema plus allergies. This has been the best daily product I have found. I do think it's key to note that you may have to get the eczema cleared up first with steroid ointment (and antibiotic ointment if infected) but then use this as a daily go to, to keep it at bay. I use very little steroid since starting the girls on this. I lather them both good twice a day. Neither complains that it stings (which with the exception of Vaseline, the 3yo cried about every other cream or eczema concoction I tried). Side Note for eczema families: I also use the SmartKlean ball for washing clothes and really like it - just fyi

review name: Worked immediately and showed great results
review text:
I've only had this product for 2 days now, and I can't be happier with the results I've already seen.
I got a flare up of eczema on my left ring finger this summer, and couldn't get it to go away. I couldn't wear my wedding rings, and no amount of steroid cream would make it go away. I've put this cream on only at night for the past two evenings, and it's completely gone. Still a little ashy , but no longer swollen, red & itchy, cracked etc. I've been able to put my rings back on during the day, with no issues.
We live in Denver and so the weather is very dry and cold right now. I've had cracks show up on a couple of my fingertips, and with this cream, they've gone from deep cuts to healed within the 2 days as well.
I won't hesitate to recommend or continue to purchase this product.

review name: If this isn't life-changing stuff, it's darn close!
review text: I can NOT get over how well this stuff works! I've struggled with dry, cracked, bleeding hands in the winter for YEARS, and nothing I've tried has really worked. I mean, yes, other moisturizers helped, but they usually required wearing gloves overnight if they're too thick or reapplication throughout the day if they're too light. With this stuff, I use a pea-sized amount on my hands right before bed, and THAT'S IT! My hands are super soft, healthy, and a complete 180 from how they normally look this time of year. I can use the cheap soap at work or in restaurants that normally irritate the heck out of my skin with no problem. It's not too thick, too scented, too anything. It's just incredible. I wish I'd found this years ago!

I am amazed, now this will be only brand I‚Äôll buy. I‚Äôve taken many photos of face before & hour later, reduced my rosacea significantly. The overall redness since childhood now includes broken capillaries. I‚Äôve got super sensitive skin that even high end moisturizers cause an immediate reaction - rash & bumps. This stuff doesn‚Äôt cause the bumps & quickly calms the redness. Oh, and I had started getting weird caking on my forehead - this helps relieve that! I never had pimples or acne, just redness since childhood - this stuff has returned my skin texture back to what it used to be! Love this stuff! Oh!! The red spots had swelled and crusted so I figured out this was eczema and it did not like fungal medication. Sheesh! Did some online searching and found that Aveeno had some eczema remedies. I had used Aveeno before so I trusted them and went with this anti itch cream. This is not an instant cure, but nothing is with eczema. I had even tried my cortisone gel to no avail. But applying this cream morning and night has not only diminished the itch, it seems to be reducing the inflammation. I get to see my podiatrist in a couple days and we'll see what he says.

Our twins tend to get eczema patches - besides hydrocortisone (which isn't good to use long-term), Aveeno eczema cream is the only daily treatment that keeps the eczema at bay. Missing even a single application/day will tend to let the eczema come back. Note that I first used the baby version of this then transitioned to the non-baby version because - the ingredients are exactly the same, in the same order, and the non-baby version is ~ $8 where as the baby version is more $11-$12 (they are tacking the term "baby" on it and charging more).
