It is the absolute best best thing that I have used to help with my itchy skin and my skin has never felt this soft! A little goes a long long way but I'm buying another jar just so I know I have it lol. I recommend this to anyone with itchy skin!

Quick background of my eczema and what I've tried to do in order to help with relief. I have minor eczema on each size of my nose, right on my inner cheek. Lately I also developed a very very small amount right at the top of my nose between my eyebrows. Over the last 2-3 years I've tried the following:

- Hydrocortisone 1% cream
- Moisturising creams, all sorts of brands
- Dead sea mud mask
- Moisturising mask left overnight
- Steam facial done by professional aesthetician

Everything I've tried from the above has either helped only a little if not none whatsoever. Figured let's Google some of the best eczema creams out there with natural ingredients and give it a shot. Most lists I came across mentioned the Aveeno Eczema Therapy Moisturising Cream as the best out there, especially with its natural ingredients such as oatmeal.

After only 2 days of using it, all I can say is WOW WOW WOW!!!! No more itching, no more redness, plus an amazing smooth patch of skin in the areas where its usually been a tad bit rough or peeling, and sometimes itchy as well.

Really love this cream and hope it continues to do what its been doing for me. Can't say that it'll do the same for every single person that tries it, but as far as my experience goes, its a lifesaver and this is why I call it my "Magic Cream."

I started using the regular Aveeno Daily Moisturizer for my eczema and it was so soothing and creamy. My skin would instantly feel relieved as soon as I applied it to my face. So I assumed the eczema formula would work even better. Nope. It's less thick so I have to apply several layers to feel even a lil relief. Hope it works for some ppl but in going back tonl the regular one.

Frankly, I'm just thankful that something works for my skin bcuz I was beginning to feel hopeless.

review name: Did NOT work for me, but might for you.
review text: Torn between giving this a 1 or 2 star. I will settle with 2 for now. This did NOT work for my eczema. It did not make it worse, but I really noticed no improvement either. I never really dealt with eczema before. However...I started getting it on my knees, elbows and on the top part of my foot around the ankles. I did have a baby 15 months ago so I am wondering if pregnancy can change your skin in that way. Anyhow....I was really disappointed, as it is an Aveeno brand and expected more. Plain hydrocortisone cream works better for me than this. I have read that it has worked for many other folks. With that in mind, if you are experiencing eczema and are in search for a lotion or cream to use, you should be able to get it on here for less than 15 bucks so I think it is worth trying. Everyone reacts differently and everyone's extent of eczema is different. Mine is not bad, just more bothersome. Sometimes you just have to keep trying until you find what works for you

I still have slight eczema on my feet and toes but this stuff has helped so much with the blisters and itch. it is very thick and is slick when you put on but once massage in not just wipe on it sinks in and relieves my problem. it is not like a lotion but more of a balm that needs to be worked into skin really well. i love it and my feet are very soft now and eczema under control!

review name: Not balm, goop. But it works.
review text: While this does really help with eczema on my legs, without irritating my sensitive skin, and stays on for hours, the texture is horrible. This is NOT a balm or lotion. The texture is closer to a thick but drippy icing, and a bit greasy feeling. More of a thin salve or thicker petroleum jelly texture. It works, but it‚Äôs not what I thought I was ordering. The smell is standard clean, oatmeal-aveeno product. Nothing great or terrible.

review name: Good product for winter but a bit sticky
review text: I love this moisturizing balm. The consistency is like pudding and it gives me true moisture. It makes my eczema less noticeable. The only reason I give this balm four stars is the sticky feel it has. After it penetrates, my legs feel super soft but it takes some getting used to. I still love the product. Especially for the winter months when my skin is at its driest.

review name: Great for toddler‚Äôs eczema, works quickly
review text: Our toddler has patches of eczema that flare up intermittently, and this has been the only product that works for her. There is no smell, it‚Äôs not so goopy that you feel like you‚Äôre applying glue, and works very quickly. This has cleared up patches that she had scratched raw, and I highly recommend it. We‚Äôve tried various other brands, including some high-end, all natural creams with no luck. This product is well worth it and very affordable. I do recommend applying this consistently, as we‚Äôve noticed the eczema will reappear slowly. But as fast as this product works, that‚Äôs no concern.

This cream is a God send. About two years ago, I developed what I later discovered to be allergic dermatitis on my eye. This is basically eczema-like reactions caused by some kind of irritant in the environment. This later spread to around my mouth as well. My doctor prescribed me a moderate steroid that I used once a week for a year to keep it at bay but I'm now using OTC hydrocortisone when the eczema gets really bad, to limit steroid strength. It gets so itchy sometimes that I can't sleep all night. However, on a day to day basis I started using Aveeno eczema therapy and it's great for moisturizing my skin and keeping it mostly at bay (I do, however, have to use hydrocortisone about once a week when it gets bad). So although this won't completely take away the symptoms for everyone, it's great for everyday use with eczema

This cream is amazing. AMAZING. It did for us what two prescription steroids and numerous other over the counter lotions could not. We used it once, maybe twice, a day for two weeks and my infant's red spots are gone. We apply now as often as needed and can go for days without an outbreak. This is the best thing I've found, and I've tried several brands of eczema lotions.

I've tried a considerable number of creams and salves - prescription, OTC, alternative - but this is the only one that keeps my itching under control. And even is healing the patches a little. I think what I have on my legs is a mixture of eczema and psoriasis, and it seems to work with both. (Not that several dermas that I've asked could give me definite diagnoses. My opinion of dermas are that they are the ones that should have flunked out of med school but they instead were allowed to be skin drs.)

Body balm texture is in between vasoline and lotion. It is heavy and moisturizing, but doesn‚Äôt feel super greasy. My son has struggled with eczema since birth, we have trialed LOTS of lotions and this works best for us. Other creams have stung my sons outbreaks, but this hasn‚Äôt caused discomfort.

Pro tip- apply directly after bath when skin is still damp to lock in moisture.

review name: Got rid of my eczema in 1 day
review text: I've been suffering from eczema for several years, affecting my elbows, waist, the back of my knees and ankles. I've been prescribed cortisone by various doctors which has always worked but I prefer not to take medications and worry about the cortisone thinning my skin. Now that summer has arrived in Toronto, I had my first breakout of 2014. I applied a generous amount of this cream overnight. I felt a cool sensation after applying it, the itch began to go away, and the next morning the amount of rashes was reduced and the itch was gone. I applied it 2 more times the next day, and the rashes were dried up or had completely disappeared. I have to admit that I'm surprised at the results and would highly recommend it to anyone suffering from eczema. Amazon.com's price is the best I've found anywhere and shipping was quick to Canada.

review name: Works very well on my mild eczema, and it has no discernable scent after I apply it.
review text: I tried various products and this one worked the best for me. Being a guy, I really did not want any scented product so this one met that requirement. Otherwise, I apply it about 1 minute after exiting the shower on any spots I need to keep moisturized. I also use it before sailing on places that typically get banged up or a lot of abrasions during a race. It does a great job.

review name: This is the only lotion that I use on my body
review text: I love this eczema formula so much. It is the only lotion I will use on my body. It is unscented, extremely moisturizing, and I don't need to reapply throughout the day. I don't have eczema, but my skin is so dry and itchy that no other lotion will cut it. I have not had the same results using the other Aveeno formulas, but the eczema one is the best! I love this product!

Great stuff!! I originally bought this product at the recommendation of another Mini-Pig owner to rub onto my pet's skin. Once I opened it, I selfishly rubbed it on my eczema-dried hands and in a couple of minutes, the dryness was gone, and the scaliness was so much improved! I've used it on my husbands dry feet, too. I bought a larger size because my pig is 125 lbs, but I'm still deciding if I should buy my pig her own jar.

My little one (3-4mo) had pimple-ly rough eczema all over his cheeks and forehead. I quickly went though a tube of the lotion and opted for the thicker balm in the tub. This stuff is even better. Highly recommend. Almost instant results. Stops the itching.

Update: nothing is perfect. Results vary day to day. This has been our favorite though. We have it throughout the house.

review name: I wasn't sure what was going on with my right hand...
review text: I'm a lefty so my right hand is generally exposed to less than my left, however for the past year or so I had noticed the skin on the inside of two fingers on my right hand had become red and very dry. After a while small blisters started to form and the skin became unbearably itchy. I had no idea what was going on. I tried some hydrocortizone cream and it worked a little, but somehow I happened across this stuff on Amazon and all of a sudden slapped myself on the forehead when I saw the word "Eczema". Of course that is what I've been suffering with. Leave it to a 30 year old guy to never go to the doctor and just let things figure themselves out. So anyway, I tried this stuff and almost immediately it stops the itching...gave it 24 hours and the red dry skin was almost gone. I've used it on a daily basis and I NEVER have the itching anymore. The red dry skin is still just barely visible on the inside of one of my fingers, but I'm willing to take that over itchy, blistering dry skin. I'm finally going to a dermatologist on Monday about a completely unrelated bump on my shoulder (wish me luck), I guess I will ask him if I really do have eczema.

This cream really helps my very very itchy skin (not eczema but acts like it). I put this on a couple times a day and my skin settles down and stops itching.
A bit heavy on the skin, but I'm not putting it on my face.
Absolutely no scent - which is good.
Highly recommend for heavy duty moisturizing.

review name: This provides relief, don't expect it to heal your eczema.
review text: Don't expect this to heal your eczema on it's own, it won't happen. Used in conjunction with a prescription steroid cream has accelerated the healing in my experiences opposed to using a steroid cream stand alone and it provides relief from any itchy or burning sensations. It's scent free as you'd expect any lotion intended to be used on eczema.

Started having eczema like symptoms on my hands third trimester of pregnancy. Isolated patches that were both itchy and painful at the same time. I had gotten other Aveeno products in the past so decided to see if this would help. Product stung a bit upon application but dissipated within ten minutes or so. Definitely helped with the itchy/dry patches.

review name: God bless Aveeno for making this product!
review text: I have had eczema off and on for my whole life. My face has had it for a couple of years. I have very sensitive skin, so I have to be very careful about what I use on it. I tried this cream. The first time that I used it, the itching stopped. The second time that I use it, my face cleared up completely! It is truly a miracle! Thank you, Aveeno, for fixing my face. :)

I have patches of dry, red and itchy skin on my right hand that wouldn't go away. I tried using Vaseline everyday with cortizone 10 and other steroid creams that didn't work. I've been using this less than 2 weeks and the patches have decreased dramatically in itchiness and redness and they're on the way to recovery. I can finally use my right hand without being embarrassed of other people noticing it!

review name: Not my favorite but not awful
review text: While thick and creamy, I didn't feel like this lotion actually moisturized my skin. I used it directly after the shower- when your skin has the most moisture to begin with- and even still after an hour my skin was visibly dry. I only have one small trouble area of eczema so I was especially surprised it didn't work very well on the rest of my body either. The scent is also just ok, somewhat medicinal.

This cream is wonderful. Worked the first time I used it on my eczema. I've had an awful time with my eczema this summer because of the ridiculously hot and humid weather we've had in the Washington, DC area. The prescription lotion my dermatologist prescribed was not working as well. I kept having to reapply it several times a day. Aveeno works for a long time and I don't have to keep reapplying it. Also, the price is less than my prescription. I believe it is worth a try for anyone with eczema.

I am finding this an effective emollient and one more of Aveeno's products that are useful. The ones carefully formulated without fragrance are especially important to those of us who are allergic to fragrances, estimated to be a quarter of the population. (Many people haven't yet realized what it is that causes their discomfort, coughing, sneezing, watery eyes, headache, mental confusion and worse - like asthma which if severe enough is life-threatening.)

Often when skin problems are treated by medical doctors, topical preparations containing steroids are prescribed. Not everyone wishes to use steroids on a long-term basis. Perhaps, then, this cream may be useful.

Because a potential online customer may need to know ingredients, I will list what is printed on my tube of this Aveeno Eczema Therapy Moisturizing Cream:

water, glycerin, distearyldimonium chloride, panthenol, petrolatum, isopropyl palmitate, cetyl alcohol, dimethicone, Avena Sativa (oat) kernel oil, steareth020, Avena Sativa (oat) kernel extract, benzalkonium chloride, ceramide NP, sodium chloride

Questions? Call the manufacturer at 1-866-429-3366 or visit the website.

What a relief!!! I have always had sensitive skin and even when a product says it is non-comedogenic blah blah blah...it still stings on my face and worse. BUT...this product is wonderful...the minute I put it on my face I felt immediately it is right for me. For the first time I don't feel any itch, burn or dryness. PLEASE...don't change this formula...it is perfect for people like me. Thank you.

review name: Love The Lotion But Developed Dry Patches On Elbows :(
review text: I really like this lotion however it's not moisturizing enough to prevent dry elbow patches from forming in winter. Yuck. I apply immediately after showering at night and again in the morning before work. I'm sorry Aveeno - I canceled subscribe 'n save and will keep looking.

Both of my sons have dealt with eczema since they were infants. One is 4 and the other is 1 yr old. We use this consistently and it has helped more than any other cream we used! My oldest son was less severe and we were able to use another type of lotion with him, but we have switched to this for both children since starting it on my youngest son. It has kept their skin clear, without the use of hydrocortisone cream, better than anything else.

This stuff is pretty darn amazing. I have eczema on my shins and have tried all sorts of moisturizers over the years to control it. While some products have helped, nothing has completed stopped the itching. I've been using this product for only a few weeks and I have already noticed a drastic reduction in irritation and itchiness. I put on a thin layer right out of the shower in the morning and again right before bed and that's enough to keep me itch-free all day. I am already starting to see some early signs of healing. Give this a go if you are looking for a reasonably priced otc eczema product!

My daughter has terrible rash on her hands from one of her jobs - she has since left that - thank goodness. However, she tried this lotion and it seems to be helping her. She says it helps with the itching, and there is a difference with the cracks, etc.

review name: W O W WORKS ON KP TOO!
review text: I used this one my eczema stress patches I get, and oh my god. I mean I‚Äôm not kidding literally the next morning it was easily 50% better, it‚Äôs amazing!! I can‚Äôt even believe how good this worked and how fast. It also made my KP significantly better too!! MUST HAVE FOR ANYONE WITH KP & or ECZEMA!

This is the only lotion/ointment that has had an effect on my 2 year old's eczema and dry skin. It's definitely on the pricier side, but it's worth it. After a few days of applying this liberally once a day, there was a dramatic improvement in her skin. Despite its thicker consistency, it's not particularly greasy, though it can leave a slight damp feeling on the skin for a while after application. Just apply before bedtime and it's not really an issue.

I wasn't expecting this to work all that well, but it does extremely well with my facial eczema (forehead + t-zone). My eczema is very rarely fully cleared, but this stuff gets it mostly all the way there without needing prescription creams. Also does just fine with my extremely sensitive, acne prone skin.

I typically use Cetaphil, but it doesn't help when I get eczema breakouts. I've also tried puriya "mother of all creams" for a week which is a nice moisturizer but ineffective for my skin. If you have had the same experience, give this stuff a shot.

I absolutely love this lotion! I've never really had dry skin but since covid hit and I work at a bank I put hand sanitizer on my hands after every customer, about once every 3 minutes. My hands started to develop a really bad rash that burned. I tried different lotions and they would ease the problem for about 5 minutes but with this lotion it completely healed it.

I've had skin issues on my hands and face for the past eleven years which started shortly after giving birth and requiring a blood transfusion. I was diagnosed with Eczema, which I discovered after some research is just that thing doctors call every skin ailment they can't figure out. They prescribed me a steroid cream for my hands but told me not to use it on my face. For that, they said spot treat with hydrocortisone. The relief for my hands was fast, but it didn't last and I was only supposed to use it after an outbreak, not preemptively. So it was a persistent cycle of use, wait, suffer, use again. I needed something better, with less warning labels and risks associated with repetitive use.

Most creams and soaps feel like they are burning after application and I end up looking red and blotchy. But this stuff is like a miracle. I can use it on my hands and face! There is NO BURNING! The dry scaly skin is gone! I've only been using this for a couple of days, in the morning after a shower and at night before bed, but I've already noticed a world of difference. I really didn't have high hopes. I though I was throwing my money away on another over the counter treatment that wasn't going to work, but I was pleasantly surprised.

This product has 1% of the active ingredient colloidal oatmeal. There is a gold bond eczema product with 2% of the same ingredient but I thought I'd give the lower dose a try first. I was extremely pleased with the results.

review name: Night time Eczema itch relief = Best solution.
review text: Nothing stopped Eczema related night time itching but this cream. Game changer. Sleep solid every night. It takes about 5-10 minutes to absorb.

review name: Works in 3 days. No more itchiness!
review text: This thing is amazing. I started to get dry skin patches around the winter season and I needed something to work on my skin. I tried using goat milk lotion, other OTC brand, and the Aveeno Eczema Moisturizing Cream was the only one that seem to stay on the longest and it's super hydrating (like beyond the surface skin level), and it didn't have a strong odor. In 3 days my dry skin patches went away and now I dont' have to scratch or smack my arm till the itchiness goes away. Thanks for making this product Aveeno! Such a life savor!

review name: Very, very good for eczema relief!
review text:
Did wonders for my eczema dry and itchy skin. First thing I found that is not steroid but actually works to relieve the symptoms. Wish it also came in a smaller jar to put in my purse. Aveeno tubes aren't as effective as this one

Highly recommend it!

Not good for sensitive skin! I don't even have eczema and my hands burn from this. Other products by this company, including the regular lotion, bath soak, and single-use moisturizing gloves, work a lot better. Cotton gloves over hand moisturizer help, too.

I bought this product as a moisturizer for my hair. I had given up on fixing the eczema on my skin. I do like it as a moisturizer for the hair, when used sparingly. But the amazing thing is that it is relieving the skin outbreak! I‚Äôm seeing a vast improvement in just a few days! I can tolerate it with my sensitive skin, and it relieves the itching! I‚Äôm not always scratching. I highly recommend this product!

Hubby loves it.
He tried so many thing including prescription ones but this one seems very light, friendly and reducing redness and dryness totally.
He also tried some of my Women's skin care but his skin is very picky lol and dont react well even to big expensive brands.
He said you have to put it on Every Day.

My daughter used it on a small rash on her wrist. Other OTC creams for various conditions DID NOT affect this particular rash. Within 24 hours of using the Aveena Eczema Therapy Moisturizing Cream, there was a significant improvement in the rash. And, with continued use for less than a week, the rash was completely gone. She will continue to use this product if there is a redevelopment of the rash in the future. The lotion is mild and pleasantly scented.

The product is fine. What I got this month was not what I had been getting. First photo shows last delivery. Second shows how the 2 tubes were packaged with no inner seal, one opened & had squirted lotion into the soft packaging. Boo.

review name: Aveeno Eczema Therapy Daily Moisturizing Cream for Sensitive Skin
review text: What a great cream for eczema on my legs! It really does do a LOT! it seems like it is going to be very hard to wipe the cream into your skin, but it does & it really makes my legs feel better - not so much drying skin - lasts for a couple days after my shower too. Would def. buy again (actually, I have already buy it again!). I really like this cream - very soothing, too.

I have very sensitive skin and it has gotten worse lately. Looked for a product that could help and give some relief. Well.... this is the product. Been using it for two days and I marvel at the improvement I am seeing. I am a believer. Thank you so much.

Ive been battling my sons eczema since birth and just recently came across this cream as ive gone through 1,000s and just wanted to try something new but wasnt expecting much and then it happened he stopped itching but not only that it was starting to heal and a little goes a long way so for the amount you get its a lot really if you have a son or you yourself are battling eczema i would give this a try really improved my babies life

review name: Amazing work on my toddler's skin!
review text:
My two year old son has incredibly sensitive skin and started to develop eczema on his face. Before going to a dermatologist, I decided to try one last product. I'm so happy I did!!!
Within a day or two of using this cream, the redness and irritation from his face disappeared. His cheeks, mouth and chin area were finally clear.
His skin feels incredibly soft and hydrated. The price is incredible (I would have paid ten times as much for these results).
I'm usually a skeptic of over the counter items, but this cream has been fantastic. Highly recommended!!!!!!

review name: Only product that helped clear my child's excema
review text: This is the only product that helped with my child's excema! I know each child has their own miracle cream that worked, but this outperformed all the expensive brands. And it just feels amazingly moisturizing.

I am ready to rave about this product! I was having an annoying rash under my eye for several months. I tried everything over the counter I could think of and home remedies. It started to spread on my eyelid and then to my other eye! I finally figured out that it was eyelid eczema and after reading the great reviews on this product, I decided it was worth a shot. I did not want to use anything with steroids on my eye, especially since that can thin your skin. I tried this Aveeno and by the next day, there was improvement. I was still holding my breath though, hoping it would continue since sometimes it can get better then worse again. I am happy to report, it continued to improve and after 2 weeks of use, I feel fairly confident that it is quite healed. I will keep putting it on once every night at least to make sure the eczema stays away. When I first used it, I was putting it on 4-5 times a day. I was also quite pleased with the size of the product, much bigger than I expected. AND a little goes a LONG way. Yay for Aveeno!!!

This is the best cream I have ever used for my eczema. I have to use it every night through the winter months to keep from getting eczema on my arms and legs and shoulders. But during the humid I only have to used it once a week. I have tried so so many other products and this is by far the best!
I love this stuff. I have been washing my hands a great deal. This has helped me heal repeatedly, and it's lasted! Only issue is if you use too much it's a little sticky. You don't need much. Works!

review name: This is awesome. I've had a really bad eczema break-out recently
review text:
This is awesome. I've had a really bad eczema break-out recently. It hurt to even open and close my hand without tearing my skin. All of my right fingers and part of my right hand are affected by eczema. After a few days of using this, i can definitely tell the difference, and my skin is getting much better. Just have to be consistent with it. I use it every night before I go to bed after a shower, and as needed throughout the day.

EDIT: 6/7/18 STILL THE BEST
Out of anything I've tried, this has been the best for the eczema I have on my hands. It helps so much when my hands are feeling dry. When my hands are dry, they start cracking and itching which leads and I frantically search for my tube of Aveeno Eczema therapy like it's a drug. It's the only thing that brings some sort of relief. I love the texture. It's not oily, but it also doesn't just disappear in a few seconds. It really moisturizes your skin.
As for the times when I have a really bad flare up and the bumps start appearing and causing pain and severe itching, this lotion doesn't make the pain go away. It really is for more addressing the dryness and mild itchiness that arises from the dryness. Also good for preventing skin cracking. I literally can't go a day without it. This is a daily must-have for me.

I had a patch of eczema that would not go away. I tried a number of creams and oils. The only thing that helped was a topical steroid which I didn't want to continue using, but as soon as I stopped, back the patch came. The Aveeno product cleared it up in a matter of weeks and took the itch away immediately. I would recommend it most highly.
I have eczema and this moisturizer keeps my dry skin under control and is not too greasy. Smells like oatmeal.

This product is great!! I had a really bad break out of eczema on my hand and arm. Within a few days with the help of this product it stopped itching and cleared up. I highly recommend this. I‚Äôm so glad I bought it.

I had a rash on my arms, likely due to a reaction between natural bug spray and the sun. It itched horribly for weeks. I tried various things, but nothing worked as well as this. I was so thankful I didn't need to use the prescription I'd obtained. In addition, it was a pleasant-to-use lotion. I'm very pleased that it worked as well for me as others stated it worked for them!

This balm moisturizes beyond what I ever expected. There's no fragrance. A couple of drawbacks is in the summer with the heat and humidity it can make my skin feel a bit tacky and I wish the itch relief lasted longer.

Product came exploded in the package. Can‚Äôt even email privately to let them know and the only way is to mail back the original to get a replacement, which doesn‚Äôt make sense to send back an exploded product.

review name: Works great baby's face with pimple-ly eczema - try the tub too!
review text: We tried so many different products. Some worked for a little bit or only helped a little. This one has by far been the best. The only thing that's been better is the tub of stuff. It instantly soothes and my 3mo stops itching his face. His skin cleared up within a day. It's still a little rough but way better. You need to apply multiple times a day to get results.

review name: Very sticky product and still irritates my sensitive skin
review text: I bought this because I was having very sensitive skin due to allergy. Very disappointed with this product, is thick and sticky on the skin, no itch-relief effect at all, my skin got more irritated after using it. Definitely not a product for sensitive skin. The lotion version works better than this balm.

review name: Helped Me! caveat; used with prescription hydrocortisone 2.5%
review text: I had an awful eczema flair, legs, arms, back. Itching EVERYWHERE. I decided to give this a try. It helped some in about 3 days. But, once I got the hydrocortisone cream 2.5%, THAT WORKED THE BEST. I am now itch free.

review name: Works better than any other non-prescription Eczema lotion and at a ...
review text: Works better than any other non-prescription Eczema lotion and at a good price. My teenage daughter and I both had cracked bleeding hands and they were cleared up in just a couple of days using this Aveeno product. I wish I would have found this years ago!

Love this lotion. My hands get really dry in the winter and this really helped. My niece has problems with her hands breaking out really bad especially when she has to work with water and any kind of cleaning agent. I gave her one of my spare tubes and it actually helped her hands considerably.

The product works well but unlike its advertising, is very greasy when first applied. It‚Äôs a think, translucent cream, similar to Vaseline. Once it‚Äôs rubbed in very thoroughly it‚Äôs skooth and soft but leaves a mild greasy residue.

Amazing! This product is clearing up my sons eczema! He has had a bad case of eczema for the past 8 months. Nothing was curing it, but this has done wonders for his skin. He doesnt itch anymore and rarely has outbreaks! Im very impressed. He even like to show me just how good his legs look in the mornings. Im pretty impressed! I use this daily, all over his body and it has really helped his outbreaks with eczema.

Update: I also use other products along with the Aveeno to help relieve the rash. I use a sensitive laundry soap, California baby eczema wash in the bath and then I use the Aveeno cream. All of these things are helping him not have the break outs of eczema. His skin looks amazing!!!!

This was a gift. My mother has sever eczema. It actually helped her itching. She's got it so bad she has to take shots. This actually started healing it after 2 years of searching for a good lotion she could use when she needed to this really worked!!

I bought this as a face moisturizer as Retin A had caused some eczema. I found it too thick and tacky for this purpose but enjoy it elsewhere on the body. I tried it on a severe case of poison oak and found it relieved the itch and healed the rash faster than I‚Äôve ever had one heal.
I'm so glad I found this cream. My rash is not gone but it is much better and going away. I have had a rash for 4 years and have tried everything. This seems to help.

Amazon sells this product at an excellent price (cheaper than at my local drug stores). It does a good job moisturizing my skin wherever I apply it. I use it on my face, hands & feet. It keeps my skin fresh & smooth and looking young.

review name: Pretty good. Give it a week or so to kick in.
review text: Ok so my ezcema problem just appeared back in Feb. 2013. Fast forward to Sept. 2013 and I've tried hydrocortisone 2.5%, eucerin lotion for very dry skin, blah blah blah. While the hydrocortisone worked for a bit my body did build up a tolerance. The eucerin worked ok for a while but was too greasy and made my skin redder. For the past month or so my ezcema hasn't been itchy so much as red and flaky. Don't get me wrong it itches now and then, but not like in the beginning. Anyway I wanted to try something natural so I tried this stuff... At first it actually irritated my skin a bit. It actually made it a little itchy. It was itchy for about 10-15 minutes. It did feel better afterward, though. I continued using it because I know I'm not allergic to oatmeal and I believe my body must've just been adjusting to this new treatment. I've been using it for over a week now and the redness is going away and it seems to be helping about as much as the hydrocortisone, except without all the steroid crap... Anyway, if you decide to buy this and it slightly (only slightly!) irritates your skin, just stick with it anyway for a few days to see if it continues. If it still irritates your skin after 3 or 4 days I'd probably quit using it...duh

review name: the best stuff for continuously dry skin

review text: I just put this lotion on for the first time and I think I'm in love. I've tried so many different lotions. I have eczema on my knuckles that cracks, bleeds, blisters, oozes, etc. and this lotion provided relief within minutes without burning. I'm amazed.

I have moderate eczema. I had a painful attack from the lanolin in the Aquaphor, so I ordered this to use after my prescription steroid cream calmed my skin a bit. The lanolin caused such a bad reaction that I had eczema all over my legs, torso, back, and the inside of my arms. I don't like to use the steroids long-term because it thins the skin. Yet when using this Aveeno product alone, my eczema was kept nearly all away. I have to apply it twice a day, though, so it is quickly disappearing. If I only put it on in the mornings, my skin gets dry and itchy by the late afternoon. I have almost used it up within two weeks, and it would be expensive to order so much of it. This product is good, but I am going to try Cetaphil upon my doctors recommendation, because one bottle has more than twice as much lotion, and I can get a two-pack at Costco for only a few more dollars than one tube of this. I just started using it today and it seems to feel about the same on my skin, where it doesn't instantly absorb and I feel totally dry and itchy after an hour. I am still giving this product four stars because it did clear up my eczema, but it just seems expensive for the quantity (about 7 oz).

I've never had any skin issues ever. No pimples or any other issues. But February of last year I spotted a small light pink patch on my the left side of my face. Didn't pay much attention to it and after a few months it become worse and the parch become bigger, red and inflamed.

Visited a dermatologist who prescribed Momate cream and a moisturizing lotion. I used it for several months (every other day). It helped reduce the redness a lot but the light pink patch always existed and it would cause breakouts. If I would stop using it for a few days it would become worse. It also left the skin looking very white and thin / flat. At the time I had no idea about steroid creams and how harmful they are.

I stopped using Momate cream immediately and after a few days the skin flared up very bad. All of the left side of my face (cheek) had become very red. It didn't itch.

After searching the net, I found Aveeno Eczema therapy moisturizing cream was the most effective. I've been using it for 20 days and the redness has reduced about 80%. There's a noticeable difference everyday. It was dark red and now It is light pink.

The first few days it made my skin very dry / flaky, tight and more red (when the cream was washed off). Maybe that is it's way to get rid of the irritated skin. The dryness continued but it kept on reducing, so did the redness and the slight swelling. The tightness has totally gone now and there's very mild dryness.

I know how frustrating it can be to deal with eczema especially if it's on your face. Please give this cream a try. It won't disappoint.

Like another reviewer's daughter, I have had really bad eyelid eczema that comes and goes with seasonal allergies. Nothing worked, until this cream. This is now my facial moisturizer. This is a miracle product for me. Every winter I get an eczema flare up. It used to pop up in small patches on my arms but in recent years it has progressed to large, ashy, cracking, incredibly itchy patches on my elbows and between my fingers. Doctors I've seen believe it is caused by wearing long sleeved jackets, sweaters, gloves etc. in the winter and thought it was caused by irritation from fabric. Here's what I have tried with limited success: hydro-cortisone cream, aloe vera, prescription steroid creams, oral anti-histamine, topical anti-histamine, oatmeal baths, bandages to limit skin contact with fabric, tons of OTC moisturizers, oils, petroleum gel as a barrier.

I was miserable. I'd spend all day feeling like my elbows were on fire, sometimes with itchiness and sometimes with pain. They would crack, bleed, looked disgusting, and there was just no way I could walk around in the winter without a jacket. I was waiting on a dermatologist referral when I decided to try this product. As soon as I applied it, I felt relief and actually said "Ahhh" out loud. I applied it many times a day for the first couple of days (I was just that itchy) and soon felt less need to apply it. After 2 weeks or so my elbows and hands looked completely normal and were no longer itchy at all. I cancelled my dermatologist appointment and switched to using the cream once every few days just as a preventative measure. My eczema stayed away for the rest of the winter, I couldn't believe it! Off all the things I've tried, this cream was the first one to bring relief and help my skin return to normal. Now I can't live without it and still use it once in awhile even in the summer if I notice a dry or itchy spot anywhere on my body.

my dermatologist gave me a couple of small jars of this balm. i have eczema on my hands, between my fingers and under my nails, same on my feet and then on my legs couple of times a year. the itching is relentless. i sometimes can't wear shoes because of the itching. i can't even stand socks. i can only wear shoes and tennis shoes with open heal in case i have to them off. i have rx creams , super strength steroid creams. he handed the small jars and said try this too. its amazing. i'm not a doctor or giving medical advice, i'm not saying it cured me because it didn't. its very soothing between my fingers and toes and i even put under my nails. it's a light weight balm, not a cream or lotion ,not like vaseline or aquaphor (which i always carry with me). it's hard to describe. it's not greasy or gooey. the minute after washing my hands and drying with a bounty paper towel as they're more absorbent, another trick i learned. i pat them dry instead of rubbing with a towel. i will use this before the itching starts as a preventative measure, you don't need globs to slither on and use through the day. there's something in this balm that has a slight numbing affect that is so soothing, maybe the oatmeal. i can tell you when i went to buy this at walmart it was 20.00. i didn't buy it. bed bath and beyond had it their large toiletry department, also 20.00, i had a 10.00 off coupon if you spend 15.00, voila i got it for 10.00. its lasting me a very long time, i don't have large areas to use it on except when the rashes on my legs crop up. so, i keep my little jars from the dr. filled from this jar and carry one where ever i am and leave one in the car. my nails and cuticles even look better since using this, probably because it's soothing and i use mostly on my hands and it works as a great cuticle cream for me. i can't say enough good things about this balm, it's not a cream. i also use on my lips . i highy recommend this balm. Amazon has the best price i have ever seen it. it's pretty large jar, like the jar of aquaphor.

review name: My KP is gone after 50 years!!!!
review text:
I bought this at Walmart so I won't come up as a "verified purchase" but I felt the need to write this review because I cannot believe the results. I purchased this out of desperation to use on a patch of skin that has been irritated for years. Unfortunately this didn't help. Determined not to waste the lotion, I decided to start using it after I get out of the shower. Since it is so thick, I actually put a glob of it in my hand and then add a little bit of water, rub my hands together, and then apply all over my arms and legs. Not only is my skin super soft, I realized after a few weeks that my KP is gone! I cannot believe it. I have struggled with KP my entire life and I am 50. I have always hated my bumpy skin on my legs and the back of my upper arms. KP is such a hard thing to fix - I've tried other products in the past and this is the only one that has worked for me. (KP = Keratosis pilaris)
If you choose to use it as a lotion on larger areas, I really encourage you to try mixing it with some water. Hope it works for you!

review name: Slight scent that lingers, slight tacky feeling, but good moisture
review text:
This is a decent moisturizer overall, especially if you have slightly sensitive skin. The brand is easy to access, has a wide selection of formulas, and comes at a reasonable price point for specialty skincare. The downside to this is that the product does tend to have shortcomings. While this is highly moisturizing, I don't feel that it absorbs fully into your skin - often leaving a tacky layer on top. The scent also tends to linger a little bit and can change if you go out in the heat or do any sort of activity, making this not a good option for summertime use or for use with workouts.
Overall, this is a good option for reducing the number of chemicals being put onto your skin, something that is a good first step for those with skin sensitivities. This does a great job at moisturizing but can tend to be sticky. I've found that using this just after showering when your skin is still damp is the best time to get the best absorption for the product.

I already had this cream in my closet from years ago. Started having red, angry, itchy cheeks creep up after going into surgical menopause a few years ago. It's also winter, cold and dry. My mom had Rosacea after menopause so I'm thinking that's probably what this is. No time for dermatologist right now. Put the cream on after being out to dinner and shopping last night in the snow and rain. Woke up this morning and my red angry cheeks looked clearer than I've seen them in years. This eczema cream provides moisture that lasts without making me break out. I still feel the moisture. Love this stuff.

review name: Here is my view of this product and why I dislike it: I recently noticed that the Avenno Baby ...
review text:
I trust and use Amazon reviews more than any other reviews on the internet. However, I am skeptical of reviews about treatments and medicines because testimonies are not proof, they are just personal experiences, and reviewers are typically not scientists and have no statistical data to back up their claims. Here is my view of this product and why I dislike it:

I recently noticed that the Avenno Baby Eczema Therapy moisturizing cream went up in price sharply in the retail stores. The price at Walmart is now about $9 for 5 oz. My son's doctor has repeatedly said this is the only cream my son, who suffers of eczema, should use, but is that true? Is this product really all that special? Are there alternatives that perhaps cost less and are perhaps even more natural?

Looking at the Avenno Eczema Therapy label, the only active ingredient is "colloidal oatmeal". If you don't believe me, check it out in their own page in the ingredients section.

So what is colloidal oatmeal? Let's see, according to Wikipedia, a colloid is "a mixture in which one substance of microscopically dispersed insoluble particles is suspended throughout another substance". Wow, isn't that common. Here are some examples of colloids ...

soda pop
whipped cream
beaten egg whites
milk
mayonnaise
lotion
Gels
gelatin
butter
jelly
Sols
ink
rubber
liquid detergent
shampoo

You can google "examples of colloids" if you'd like to verify this. Seriously? A colloid is nothing special. So then what is "colloidal oatmeal"? A little bit of googling for "can I make colloidal oatmeal at home" brings up a bunch of articles that make a lot of sense. Here is an example from Dermnet: "Colloidal oatmeal is a finely ground form of oatmeal that readily absorbs water. It can be prepared by using a food processor, blender or coffee grinder". Wow, so colloidal oatmeal is simply oatmeal flour with water!

Let's take a look at the other "unique" ingredients in the Avenno Baby Eczema cream. According their own label, ALL of the other ingredients in the cream are inactive ingredients, as follows: water, glycerin, panthenol, distearyldimonium chloride, petrolatum, isopropyl palmitate, cetyl alcohol, dimethicone, avena sativa (oat) kernel oil, steareth-20, benzalkonium chloride, ceramide NP, sodium chloride, avena sativa (oat) kernel extract.

So... it also has oat kernel oil and extract, but they recognize this is an inactive ingredient, meaning, it is not a medicine. The rest of those inactive ingredients are common ingredients in most skin creams.

My conclusion is, this cream is not that special, and I would be able to help my son better by making colloidal oatmeal at home.

I love Amazon and buy here all the time, so I almost feel guilty for writing a negative review, but I had to be transparent on this one.
