review text: This balm has been a skin saver. I get this odd rash that shows up in patches like eczema but I can't be positive that is what it is. Nothing has really worked for long. I use this stuff where I usually break out right after I shower and on the taste occasion I break out again it isn't even 1/12 as severe as it would be without it. Best part is the break out goes away within a day or two and doesn't itch on those few occasions. This sucks to your skin better than lotion as well so you don't have to reply every 5 minutes. I could not be more happier with this Aveeno eczema balm, it literally saved my skin.

review name: A huge help both with steroid cream and as a substitute for steroid cream
review text:
Once upon a time, Aveeno made the most amazing eczema cream, with hydrocortisone and colloidal oatmeal. They've changed the formula, sadly, but at least they still make this stuff.

I don't know why or how, but colloidal oatmeal is a real miracle worker for eczema. I still sometimes need the steroids -- both OTC hydrocortisone and various prescription creams when things are dire -- but thank heavens for this cream, because it really helps me taper off the steroids. It's not only soothing for my raw skin, but somehow it actually helps to heal it.

In case you didn't know, regular steroid use can damage your skin and actually make it more vulnerable to allergic reactions and eczema. If you need steroids, the best advice I can give you is to use them as little as possible for as short a time as possible. Try this stuff with the steroid cream and you may find you can get rid of the steroids a lot sooner. It works for me.

review name: but it was just so painful and the Cerave stung so much while having no ...
review text:
I have suffered from dry, itchy, weeping (clear fluid) skin patches on the sides of my nose and my chin on and off for a few years of my life. I moved to the US last November and temperatures where I live have reached -20C (-4F) which made my face more upset with me. I went out and bought Cerave moisturiser and at first it was... okay. It was a little thin, but it seemed to keep everything at bay.

Recently the hot, humid weather of summer has hit us and my skin weirdly reacted to it with a vengeance. This has never happened to me in the summer before, but it was just so painful and the Cerave stung so much while having no effect that I knew I would have to change products.

First, I bought a small tube of regular Aveeno daily moisturiser and would apply it to the worst parts of my face on top of the Cerave. If anything, this seemed to make my skin extra angry, though I fruitlessly continued, hoping it was just taking its time to react. After a month, I conceded defeat.

I researched my condition properly and realised I most likely had something called perioral eczema. I googled pictures of it and it was like looking at my own face. Armed with this self-diagnosis (don't judge), I started researching over the counter cures because I don't want to use steroids. What I saw mentioned a lot was Cerave (-_-) but then I came across a blog posting of a woman who used the Aveeno eczema therapy cream and the Aveeno baby bath wash/shampoo. I ran out to Walmart and bought them both despite the $11 price tag on the cream. Seeing that it's $17ish here, I would recommend buying it from Walmart if at all possible.

As soon as I got home, I washed and moisturised my face with these products. The results were immediate. I mean yeah, the red skin was still there, but it felt so much calmer. The stinging and itching all but vanished. I did get some itchiness a couple of hours later, but applying a little more cream helped immensely.

I have continued to wash and moisturise my face twice a day and my eczema is now gone! I didn't even know my facial skin had the ability to be so smooth. Even my husband has been impressed with the dramatic improvements since he has been so used to seeing me look like I partake in rubbing sandpaper on my chin.

One word of caution: The moisturiser goes a long way. I squeeze out maybe an inch to an inch and a half of product and rub it into my entire face. Anymore than that and you'll become an oil slick immediately. Your face will become oily as the day goes on, but if you just wash it off and apply another coat after, it'll help. I'd rather be a little oily than how I was before, anyway.

I would recommend this to anyone with facial eczema who has not tried this yet. It won't work for everyone, just like Cerave doesn't work for me but works with many others.

Edit: Unfortunately I have had to downgrade this review from 5 to 4 stars. While it does a good job moisturising the normal parts of my face, as the summer went on and the cold snap of autumn has arrived, my eczema has come back with a vengeance and now this cream and the baby wash do nothing for me. My face is worse than it has ever been before. I don't blame the Aveeno products, I think maybe it's something in my diet. I just wanted to come back and warn that this isn't a miracle product, you will need to find out what is actually causing your eczema; this will just relieve the feeling of itching and pain.

The Aveeno Eczema Therapy Moisturizing Cream For Sensitive Skin works really well. It applies well not being greasy or sticky. It takes a couple of minutes to absorb into the skin fully but does an excellent job when it does.

There's a slight scent but it's not overwhelming nor bothersome. It tends to dwindle out after some time.

My skin gets awfully dry during the winter, especially my hands and this has been working well in keeping the dryness and itchiness away. My feet, hands, and face need this the most!

My son has eczema and always gets flares during this time and I am pleased to say this product has helped him! It helps heal during flares and I'm certain it's kept some of his flares away. Some products have been hit and miss the results of agitating his eczema further, I'm pleased this hasn't!

Aveeno offers easy gentle application and in return soothed non-irritated skin. This product is a must to have in the medicine cabinet year round for my family.

review name: deals well with redness and itching
review text:
My main use of this moisturizer was for red, itchy patches on the back of my hands behind my thumbs where dry skin gets aggravated by taking rubber gloves on and off. I was mainly hoping the redness would go away and, if it kept them from getting dry again, that would be a bonus. By applying it twice a day, I did see signinficant improvement in my symptoms. The redness vanished entirely, itching stopped, and the skin was less dry (though still a bit dry as evidence by some white, flaking skin that remained). Since the dryness I experience is due to pulling gloves on and off, I think this was about as good a result as I could expect and I was satisfied with its performance.

In terms of scent, this doesn't have much of one and isn't perfumey. It goes on smoothly and absorbs well. I didn't experience any greasy residue afterwards.

Pros: absorbs well, takes away redness and itching, no unpleasant scent
Cons: none

This works like a miracle. I have face eczema one or twice a year for the past 3 years due to allergy, and it always disappear after a steroid shot and a week of prescription pills. This summer it came back again. I went to the hospital as usual and got a shot and a week of pills. But after that week, it came back again. It disappears for two days and reappear for 2 days for about a month, and suddenly it got worse that I could not stand it anymore. I went to the allergy clinic and got a blood test for allergy. They also scheduled an appointment for me to get skin tests to find out exactly what i am allergic too. But because of those tests, I could not take any allergy pills for at least 5 days and steroid shot/pills for 6 weeks. My face was so bad during this period that I decided to go online and do some research. I found this cream and the white vinegar and decided to give a try. After 12 hours of using them, my face was much better, and after 3 days I could not even see the eczema on my face. I will still get my skin tests for allergy, but I will continue using them until I feel safe to stop. A bonus is that my acne even gets better.

review name: Wow! Dramatic Results After Just One Application!
review text:
For some time, I have had a small patch of eczema on my face, just to the left of my left eye. I have tried many ordinary moisturizers but nothing seems to help. Although it is not severe and is barely visible to others, I can see it. so it really bothers me.

When Amazon offered me a tube of Aveeno Eczema Therapy Moisturizing Cream, I figured what did I have to lose. I had never tried a product specifically labeled for eczema before. I expected that I would apply it for two or three days and come back to report the results. I was not very hopeful, as I have never had much luck with regular moisturizers, even expensive ones.

What a pleasant surprise! After only one application I could see and feel the difference the next day. Flaking and itching have all but disappeared and the redness I associate with this patch of eczema is gone. After two days, the results were even more dramatic. I am very happy with this product and recommend it 100%.

It's not often when I review a product I picked up from a supermarket but people who suffer from eczema like myself NEED to know about this stuff!

A couple times a year I get quite bad eczema on my cheeks going up to my ears and down to my neck to the point I've been stared at and told I look diseased. Coupled with anxiety the duo would often be enough to shelter home and cancel everything until my skin cleared.

I was skeptical at first, fearful even seeing as every single other product and lotion I have tried would burn horribly. But I took the chance and am so happy I did. Instantly my skin felt relieved. And by that evening it already began to fade. It's been 2 days and it's almost gone! Normally this would be a 1-2 week ordeal but this stuff really does work magic.

Could not recommend it enough. The only gripe I have is that the product is on the pricier side as far as lotions go but it's worth every penny if eczema is holding you back like it did me.

review name: Good cream, but should be used in addition to general body lotion due to price
review text:
I first must say that this cream is absolutely helpful when you need some relief from itching. That being said I find that it should be reserved for the times when I've forgotten about a spot or something in particular has flared up due to its price. Eczema for me is more about proper management, and this means application of lotion twice a day. It hasn't mattered too much what type of lotion I put on my body, so long as I remember to do it.

This cream does work around the eyes, but it eventually bleeds into my eye and causes me to tear. For eyes I recommend Radiance eye cream with royal jelly from Burt's Bees. Very very expensive, but you only use tiny amounts around your eyes and it will last two people for quite a long time. I'm guessing I would need to buy two of them per year.

That being said, this cream does have a nice feel on your skin after you put it on. It is not particularly heavy and oily. If you have eczema I would recommend having one of these handy, but its not necessary for your general body lotion, which is the most important part.

review name: Great for Eczema; wish it came in larger sizes
review text:
This cream is actually a lot cheaper to purchase on Amazon than a lot of local places I searched. I bought two creams at Walgreens ($13.64ish) only because they had a deal on two and I had a coupon for two, so it worked out for me. But when I run out, I will most likely purchase from Amazon.

Onto the product. This is really great! I am currently 23 years old, and I have had skin issues for (what it seems) all my life. When I was younger the doctors described it as rashes, so on that went. Then in my teenage years I was told it was Eczema. Now in my 20s I'm told by my doctor and a dermatologist that I have both Eczema and Psoriasis. Fabulous. At least now they've narrowed it down. I started getting signs of Eczema in new areas and it worried me, so along with recommendations from my dermatologist, I researched and found this as a solution that worked for many online. I wasn't extremely comfortable applying steroid cream to my eyelids and face, so I tried this out, and it has truly helped me out. Now the issues haven't disappeared, and since I am African American discoloration will apparently stay with me for years to come, but the roughness and apparent obviousness of the issues I had on my forehead, cheek and eyelids have diminished at a great capacity. So this cream is one that I apply to both my face and on my hands. I get dry hands easily and therefore have several places on my hands that are issues for me (which is why I always carried lotion in each bag and in my pockets if I could), and although I haven't seen the same result on my hands that i have of my face, I will not give up. I just love that after I apply this to my hands, they look and feel moisturized. I find that with some lotions after I apply them to my hands, they still look dry. It would get on my nerves! But I don't have that issue with this lotion.

This lotion is amazing, and although I have used Aveeno previously for years at different times, I never knew of this version. Too bad this is the largest size, but this is already one of the most expensive products from the line, so I can only imagine how much that would cost. But I highly recommend this to anyone with skin issues such as Eczema or Psoriasis.

I suffered from eczema on my eyelids for over a year. I‚Äôve tried everything. Coconut oil, olive oil, aloe, creams, and even prescription steroids. This is the only thing that worked. After washing my face with virgin olive oil and a warm washcloth, I applied this cream while it was still damp. I did it every hour for the first day. Then twice a day for the next three days. On the first day I noticed a drastic decrease in itching. On the following three days the eyelids began to heal and I can say now after less than a week my eyelids are healed. I began to use it on my ears yesterday and they are also beginning to heal after over a year of peeling, itching, and cracking. I gave this to a coworker who had the same results on her eyelids as I did. I highly recommend this cream!

review name: Beware of reactive ingredients for eczema sufferers.
review text: Be aware if you are allergic to benzalchonium chloride (a known chemical that those who suffer from eczema react to). I used this as a lotion to keep my eczema at bay, & immediately broke out in horrible itchy bumps. I had to apply ice packs & suffer extreme itching for 15 to 20 minutes before it began to calm down. ALWAYS read the ingredients! Aveeno should know this is a reactive ingredient for those with eczema.

I actually purchased at my local Grocery Outlet store for $9.99 but even at the selling price on Amazon, I would have gladly paid more. I‚Äôve been dealing with eczema last four years with no luck from my doctors to help with the itching all over my body. I don‚Äôt know what brought it on in the first place but it hasn‚Äôt gone away. I‚Äôve tried various topical prescription ointments, OTC anti-itch creams and nothing has helped until I met my new BFF, Aveeno. This stuff works great, practically immediate relief. Ahhh, no more middle-of-the-night scratching. I can actually get some solid sleep again. Give it a try it, it works and might be your next BFF too.

review name: with Cortizone being the absolute worst! The Cortisone seemed to just make the eczema ...
review text:
Every Winter, my hands get especially dry leading to a reoccurrence of the dreaded
eczema.
I've tried everything, with Cortizone being the absolute worst!
The Cortisone seemed to just make the eczema worse, by drying everything out
even more.
Just this past year, i've discovered Aveeno Eczema therapy at my local grocer.
I decided to try it, and months later my hands have never looked better.
Currently, it is a frigid 8 degrees in Boston, and no eczema or excessive dryness on
my bare hands.
I use it sparingly, twice a day, and it not only clears up any redness or itching, it
also acts as a shield against the outside elements.
I'm thoroughly impressed, because the difference since using this product is huge.

Now, i actively seek out all of the Aveeno products.

The shave gel is also fantastic, especially if you have dry or sensitive skin.

Also note: I am male, so this product is not just made for beauty conscious women.

I have two little boys that have battled eczema pretty much since they were born. We have tried everything from oils, prescriptions, changes in diet, changes in detergent,gentle soaps, oatmeal soaks and everything in between. I came upon this product in the 5 oz size at a local Walgreens while looking for anything that seemed like it would ease their discomfort from their itchy, scaly eczema on their hands, tummy, legs, feet and bottoms. I paid nearly $10 for it there, but it was worth it! After 3 days of use the texture of their skin changed from rough to soft and supple and their eczema cleared up!

They still have breakouts that are triggered mostly by heat or stress, but this lotion helps keep the breakouts to a minimum so I don't have to apply their prescription medicated ointment very often. We also keep baths super short and wash with aquaphor baby. We use this lotion once a day before bed or after a bath.

After having struggled with them suffering with eczema for so long and buying heaps of products that don't work and feeling frustrated I was relieved to find something semi-cheap and non-prescription that finally really worked. It broke my heart to see them scratching their little spots till they cracked and bled even though I was applying Vaseline heavily to the areas. Buy this, use it everyday and see the difference. It's well worth every cent.

review name: It helps, but what really helps is this book" ...
review text: It helps, but what really helps is this book" Is This Your Child?" by Doris Rapp M.D.It tells how to find hidden allergies (single food & multiple food elimination diet or rotary diet, then you observe- after eating problem food itching (with eczema) starts within 15-60 minutes.You stop this food for 3-12 weeks (depending on reaction) & start slowly.For example, if milk is a problem,start with one-half teaspoon at a 4 day interval.In 4 days you drink 1 teaspoon & so on till 1 cup a day at a 4 day interval.If 4 teaspoons were ok, but 8 teaspoons caused problem,you stop for a few weeks & start with 4 teaspoons at a 4 day interval for 4-8 weeks.Then you increase by 1 teaspoon every 3-4 weeks.When flare-up, restrict histamine rich food (all sour & fermented food, citrus, nuts, berries,chocolate,avocado, fish & meat that wasn't cooked or frozen right away ( I buy frozen ).It helps.

review name: This product did nothing for extremely dry, cracking skin
review text:
I have extremely dry skin, and when my eczema flares up, my skin itches and cracks easily. I liked how Aveeno Eczema Therapy absorbed quickly and didn't have any strong smells. Unfortunately, it didn't provide any relief to my eczema. After the first few minutes, my skin returned back to its dry, itchy state. It did nothing to heal or protect it.

Having done a lot of research on eczema remedies, it seems not everyone's eczema is the same, and not everything works for everyone. For my type of eczema skin, the only moisturizers that seem to work need to be rich and on the oily side. I found Shea Moisture and Eucerin Eczema Relief to be better moisturizers. For treatment of craking and itchy skin, I use Elidel, a prescription non-steroid product that has worked for treating my eczema. Burt's Bees Hand Salve is also pretty good.

This lotion has cured my eczema problem!! For 20 years I had recurring eczema on my forehead and cheeks that I would keep only slightly under control with Psoriasin, it would help a little, but I was fighting a losing battle.

So I decided to give this Aveeno lotion a try. The way I did it, is first BEFORE I tried the Aveeno, I applied a prescription triamcinolone acetonide cream for several days to clear the eczema up (I had never tried the cream before, it was prescribed to me for something else, and I can't remember what made me think to try it). And then after my skin got mostly cleared up, I started applying the Aveeno lotion at least once a day, sometimes twice, and I haven't had any eczema breakouts since! The Aveeno keeps them from happening. And it's a good gentle moisturizer for my face.

I've been using the Aveeno for about 2 years now, and have not had the slightest bit of eczema in that time. I don't use or need any other eczema products, only this lotion. I am always amazed when a skin product does what it says it will do, but this one delivers. So glad I found it. :-D

I love this cream! I actually have "contact dermatitis", not eczema (my skin breaks out in a rash when it comes in contact with chemicals, cheap jewelry, etc.) I had a small spot of a rash on my neck from a necklace and used some prescription hydrocortisone cream on the spot for about a week, but the rash just kept getting bigger and redder. I saw this cream at my local grocery store and thought I would try it. After 2 days of use, the rash is almost gone! The rash was bright red, terribly itchy and covered the whole left side of my neck for several days and this cream helped stop the itching and begin the healing really quickly. I'm definitely keeping some of it on hand at all times!

review name: Worked well for my scaly, red, patchy, flaky, angry, goose-like skin
review text:
I moved to be with my husband 6k miles and his area this season is pretty much freezing. My skin started to dry and flake up. I regularly take showers in the morning and let's just say that just exacerbated my skin condition. It began getting red, irritated, scaly, angry and very very itchy. So of course, I scratched.

This went on for 2 weeks, since I didn't know where to go nor did my husband, my awesome in-law took me to Target and got me this tube. Worked awesome...within 2-3 days my skin started to itch less, and began showing signs of recovery.

I have had dry skin all my life but it wasnt much of a problem cause I lived in high temp/high humidity area and I just had to put moisturizer on to alleviate it, moving to a cold place with low humidity made the dry skin worse and that's where Aveeno comes in.

Before this starts sounding like a paid commercial, let's just say Aveeno has always worked for me while others haven't and just because it worked for me doesn't mean it will work for everyone. I highly recommend it, though.

Pros: It worked great and is affordable.
Cons: I do not like the smell, it is very light and...kinda smells like..:)

review name: Amazing miracle cream changed my life!
review text:
I haven't been officially diagnosed with eczema, but my forehead has become increasingly itchy, flaky, and blotchy with red spots the past few years, and no normal lotions helped beyond very temporary relief. I would often just mention something about the weather when my skin was really bad, but it was always very embarrassing for me.

I happened upon this product one day at the grocery store and thought I'd give it a try. I noticed a difference after the very first use! My skin felt hydrated and smooth, and the itch was gone. After just 3 days of using a very small amount each day, my skin is remarkably clearer. The itch and flaking are completely gone, and my skin coloring has evened out quite a bit. I no longer feel embarrassed about my skin, and have even received compliments since using it.

review name: Best eczema product I have ever tried.
review text: I had a huge patch on my palm, under my fingers and into the palm. Looked and felt like a tough callous and itched like crazy. Instant itch relief and the eczema patch cleared up in two days. I saw several reviews indicating it made their baby‚Äôs skin worse. This product is NOT intended for babies. There is a similar balm labeled ‚Äúbaby‚Äù. This one is for adults. It has a pleasant but unobtrusive scent. I am very satisfied. Works better than my prescribed steroid cream.

review name: safe for even the smallest of eczema sufferers
review text:
Our son was born on 9/26/11 and had eczema from the get go.
A few patches on his face were the most notable. We gave it some
time to see if it might clear up on its own and then I ordered this
based on the positive reviews. I took it with me to his 1 month
well check and the pediatrician gave us the okay to use it. Sure
enough, within about 3 days the spots were noticeably better. Two
weeks in and you could hardly see a thing. We apply this every day
because I have noticed that if we go several days without it, then
the eczema will flair up again, especially with it being winter time.

This cream is steroid free and fragrance free. It has a very creamy,
smooth, non greasy texture that absorbs quickly. We have used
this cream on our newborn and ourselves with incredible results.
Subscribe and Save option is drastically less expensive than buying
at the stores here. S&S is about $7.75 per 7.3 ounce bottle and in
the stores here is is $7.99 for a 5 ounce bottle. A little goes a long
way and we've found that 2 bottles every 3 months is what we use.

review name: I tried this hoping it would be more effective than ...
review text:
I tried this hoping it would be more effective than the Aveeno Active Naturals Skin Relief Moisture Repair Cream Intense Moisture (http://www.amazon.com/Aveeno-Relief-Intense-Moisture-Repair/dp/B00B08ON5E) which was the first product I've EVER used that has made the mild to moderate eczema on my hands go away, if only temporarily. To my surprise, it doesn't seem to work as well AND it's much greasier and more expensive. Surprising also because the Skin Relief isn't specifically advertised for eczema and the Eczema Therapy is. Go figure? Anyway, back to the Skin Relief cream for me!

Update: The Aveeno Skin Relief Moisture Repair Cream Intense Moisture stopped working so I went back to this and it works! Now it's the only thing that has worked consistently. I don't know why the other stopped working but at least this one works and works very well. I have updated it to 5 stars.

I have been fighting Eczema for awhile now. And i tried everything i could think of. At first when i noticed how i was having issues with the lotion i was using at the time, i decided i was going to try something else. With in a few days of using the new stuff, i realized yet again i was having problems. So to make a long story short, i ended up going though five or six brands before switching to the aveeno. I was tried of just making things worse with my skin. So now i use their soap, bath soak, bath, lotion, shower oil, and the shampoo and conditioner! It has helped me alot! Although i haven't bought any of this product from Amazon, i do use on a daily basis. It has helped my skin in so many ways its unreal! Even though i do still have flare ups every now and then, it does help that icthy and dry feeling.

review name: If you have eczema or just severely dry skin, keep reading.
review text: This winter has been brutal on my hands; I have eczema but this year in particular, my hands flared up BAD. My hands were super super super dry and painful. No Korean skin lotion could save these hands. But then I found this! My hands were saved!! Is it pricey? Yes. Is it worth it? Worth every penny. This lotion works more like an ointment that heals your hands with every use. Only after a very days, my hands are gradually healing. I was pleasantly surprised to find this miracle lotion. It works awesomely; your hands stay moisturizer for hours. If you have very dry skin in generally, check this out. I recommend this; 10/10.

review name: Please please don‚Äôt use on Food Allergy Babies!
review text: I have seen a countless number of testimonies AFTER my son ended up with an anaphylactic reaction after using this product. If your child is prone to allergies, please please don‚Äôt be fooled by the marketing. This product has some serious allergens. My son ended up in the hospital and we‚Äôre currently on steroids and Benedryl and his reaction still isn‚Äôt out of his system. If your child is prone to allergies, please please research further before using this product!

I'm not normally an eczema sufferer, but I recently developed a bad (itchy, flaky, red, peeling) rash as a reaction to a particular sunscreen I had used. I treated it in part with a 1% hydrocortisone cream, but the skin was pretty dry, too (it's winter here and the temperature has been below average). I wanted to use a moisturizing lotion on the affected areas to promote skin healing.

I like that the ingredients list is short (it's available on the product page) and that this lotion is free of parabens. (I recognize the ingredients in this lotion from other products I use and know that I'm not allergic to any of them!) I love that there are no dyes or artificial fragrances, since I have sensitive skin.

I've been using this for three or four days now, and I think it is really helping. I apply it to the affected areas twice a day. It goes on smoothly and is not greasy or oily. It does an excellent job of keeping my skin moisturized, and even after only a few days of use, the peeling has stopped. After I apply it, I wait a few minutes and then add my hydrocortisone cream.

Once my rash has cleared up, I'm going to keep this around and use it as a general moisturizing body lotion. I can't say how it works for people with chronic eczema, but if you have a temporary dermatitis rash, this lotion would be great as a part of your treatment strategy.

I rarely take the time to write reviews but this product is a literal miracle. My 2 year old suffers from eczema and nothing helped. Not steroid cream, not coconut oil, not oatmeal baths. He was miserable, covered in red sand paper rashes. I saw this at Target and decided to try it, as I was desperate for anything that might help him. In two days of use all his rashes are gone. Vanished. Healed. I am totally blown away. This stuff must be made of rainbow wishes and unicorn tears. I could shout praises for this product from the rooftops. Five stars. A billion stars. Best product ever made.

This moisturizing cream worked wonders for me. I started using it about a year ago when the weather began to get a little colder and drier. The skin above my eyelids tends to get very dry to the point where it gets red and cracks. It would be flaky and I would be so embarrassed when people would point it out. I tried sooo many lotions and creams and ointments and nothing worked. I'm not too sure if the dryness above my eyes was considered eczema, but I figured I'd give this product a try any way. It took a few weeks of consistently applying this cream every night and now the skin above my eyes doesn't get dry anymore. I'm soooo glad I found this cream. It's so thick and moisturizing. I definitely would recommend this to anyone with dryness around their eyes!

review name: Best lotion I have ever used!
review text: This is hands down the best lotion I have ever used. I have very dry, sensitive skin that gets worse in the winter. I have never been formally diagnosed with eczema but every winter my face breaks out with small red patches of skin that are very dry, to the point of flaking and peeling. Normal lotion has never done anything to help these spots. I have been using this lotion on my face as my daily moisturizer and have not had a single dry spot break out this winter. It has a pleasant smell and a very smooth, light texture. It is not heavy or greasy and has never left my face oily. It does not burn when I apply it to drier skin like many lotions have in the past. Love this!

review name: Works well for my dry skin
review text: When I first moved to El Paso, I had dry skin, but it wasn't too bad. Then for some reason, after I went home for the holidays and came back, the dry skin was really bad. I tried different types of lotions and finally what worked was a humidifier along with this lotion. For my face, Pond's dry skin cream works (the blue one) but for the front of my neck, the dry skin can get really bad & start to feel really dry and rough within a matter of minutes after stepping out of the shower. My other lotions don't work for my neck, but this lotion does & I'm glad I bought it. Sometimes I have to apply it 3-4x before the dryness goes away, but it eventually does. Sometimes I forget to apply it before going out & then by the time I get home, my skin's already started flaking off. This lotion's the best I've found so far for this random patch of dry skin.

I've used this for a month. It is soothing and relieves the itch, but I haven't seen any massive changes. My eczema didn't disappear in two days, like some reviewers said it did for them. My eczema's still there, after a month, though it's gradually diminishing.
Don't overapply this because it can backfire. Don't apply it too many times a day on one spot and don't apply it where it isn't necessary.
The price was reasonable.

I have had eczema since I was a small child and my skin is super sensitive, dry, scaly, patchy, itchy (you get the idea). I have tried almost every over-the-counter product out there to no avail and the prescription creams and ointments stop the itching but do little to clear up the demarcation left by the rash. I purchased this product with the attitude of "it can't hurt", and honestly, I didn't expect much from it. Well surprise, surprise - 72 hours after using it for the first time, my skin felt great, the scales were gone and the marks on the back of my hands started to clear up. I love the fact that this product is not at all greasy and that it's unscented. Needless to say, I don't need fragrance to add to my skin irritation woes. If you have eczema or even just really dry skin I would highly recommend this product.

review name: Nothing OTC works better for me.
review text:
I have been using a similar product from Aveeno for years as my emergency hand cream. I have some kind of eczema reaction from using dish soaps on the back of my hands. I have never been diagnosed because mine is very mild. It's just extremely dry, scaly, and rarely cracks and bleeds. They used to offer this same thing but in their Baby Care line. I used that entire bottle and then I found this, which is the exact same thing with oatmeal extract. It's the only cream that has ever really soothed my skin and made it feel soft and comfortable again.
The consistency isn't too thick. And once it's absorbed, it helps the relieve pain from the worst areas that have cracked. Basically makes the obvious signs of scaling or drying vanish the same day.
The next best thing would be straight neosporin, but that stuff is so greasy and unpleasant, and you really dont want to rub it everywhere because then it will not absorb and just transfer to everything else. So to really cure my hands I use this all over and then neosporin over bad spots and using bandaids for one night/day. Then it's all better by the next day.
Just have to switch to a milder hand soap, or wear disposable gloves more often.
I don't think this stuff smells like anything special but that's a good thing. When your skin is irritated, the last thing you should do is put an unnecessary fragrance on it, that's only going to make it worse.
I would highly recommend this for anyone who really struggles with dry skin or eczema.

Overall, this product helps relieve my eczema. The only problem I have is that everytime I apply it, my hands burn for about 2-5 minutes. But, after it's done burning, my hands feel great! They no longer hurt or itch for a couple of hours.

It breaks my heart to see my little one scratching all the time. From before he even knew how he was scratching. I tried several products but this has been the best relief for his eczema. I wish it wasn't so expensive. I only use it all over once a day because it is so expensive but I use it liberally every time I see him itching in that one particular spot.

My husband has bad eczema and was using a lot of steroid cream. I know that steroid cream is very bad for clean skin so I wanted to try something else. This is cream is very smooth and leaves skin feeling soft and moisturized. Only downfall is that it is very expensive.

I have no doubts that this works great for the non-pregnant. In my case, I developed eczema when I became pregnant with my 3rd (never had this problem with my previous pregnancies)--I was getting unbearable itchy rashes everywhere on my body. Obviously not wanting to take any drugs or use any creams that could endanger the baby, I was hesitant in using anything other than a mild topical steroid cream, to no avail. My midwife recommended some sort of lotion, can't remember what it was called, but while looking for that cream I came upon this cream from Aveeno. I've always been a huge fan of Aveeno, ever since my first was born because their products are so gentle and natural... within days of using this cream, the itchiness and rash disappeared! I've been using this for the past few months and it's done wonders for my skin, not only in the itchiness department, but also keeping my skin extremely soft and smooth (and I've always had a problem with dry skin).

Use this product if you have eczema, you won't be disappointed!

review name: I actually look at myself in the mirror again
review text: This cream has given me life. I've had breakouts of eczema on my face for years now. I used to use a $35 cream to try to control it and sometimes it worked and sometimes it didn't, but Aveeno worked period! I used a facial scrub to get rid of the dead flakes and began applying this cream. In 3 days (Yes 3 days) my skin is so smooth like a baby's! I AM SERIOUS! If you saw how i looked like leftover snake skin on my face and saw me today your jaw would DROP! I love looking at the mirror and I feel pretty again. I don't hide my face or am ashamed of my face. This cream made me love my face again. I can't thank you enough Aveeno!

A miracle worker! I have had weird red, non-itchy patches on my face for 6 months now, they came out of nowhere. Also, my lips have been so dry and my ear lobes have been dry and cracking.... My dermatologist thought it might be mild eczema, and gave me a steroid cream. The cream worked fine for a while, but I didn't like to use it too much because of the side effects it could have. The other day my patches got out of control and one patch almost seemed to have some kind of crazy allergic reaction, it was AWFUL. I have been searching and searching online for months, and over the weekend came across this cream. I bought it and used it. My ears were smooth about 5 minutes after applying it. My red patch swelling went down, the dryness on my face disappeared overnight, and the redness itself was gone in 3 days. Thank you aveeno!!!!!

I suffer from painful eczema on my hands that causes the skin to blister, peel, and crack when I come in contact with soap and water. Since that isn't avoidable my hands were in constant distress and all my doctors thought to do was prescribe stariod creams that did little if applied daily and the side effects are awful. Three days after trying this hand cream and my skin is completely healed and almost normal looking. In a day or two I expect it will look completely normal and for once my hands aren't in pain, and let me tell you, it's a godsend especially since I'm a Chef and a sales clerk. I'm no longer embarrassed about my hands and they don't hurt anymore!

Finally a product that helps my eczema! I've been suffering and tried everything. I've had this only a few days and most of my eczema is already starting to clear up. I love the consistency of this cream. It's not greasy or thin. It has minimized the itchiness too. I will definitely be stocking up on this!

review name: Long lasting relief for dry, itchy skin
review text: This is wonderful for soothing the dry, itchy patches of skin that bother me every winter. My dermatologist says to stay moisturized and this does a great job, plus it also stops the itchy, scratchy feeling. It takes a few minutes to absorb completely compared to the lotion I have been using (CeraVe), but it lasts longer and hours later my skin still feels moist.

review name: I SWEAR THIS PRODUCT WORKS ON MY FACE AND FOREHEAD!
review text: For the past 6 years, I have been suffering from Eczema or Dermatitis particularly on my forehead, and it was getting worse and worse over time, the areas come larger, itchier and more noticeable due to dark patches. I have been visited my doctor and two other dermatology doctors, and often time they ended up recommended me prescription medicines that contained "steroid" such as Hydrocortisone Cream or other drugs such as: Protopic or Elidel. I have used them over the years and they only helped me temporarily and the itch would come back flair up again after a few days. The side-effect these drugs caused my forehead skin thinny, dry and dark patches. Finally one day I got fed up and did some research online and came across this "new" product called Aveeno Eczema Therapy Moisturizing Cream. After using this product continuously for two weeks (morning and night) - make sure you wash your face with Cetaphil Gentle Skin Cleanser - before you apply the Aveeno . And I swear this product worked on my face and forehead after two weeks of use. Don't give up after 3 days of used and called it quit, you have to be patient and give it two weeks to work into your skin. This product is SAFE and it is accepted by National Eczema Association. I will continue to use this every day to keep my face soft and moisturize. I would definitely recommend this new product to anyone who suffers with similar conditions as I have. It only cost $11.00 so you don't have anything to lose BUT you have A LOT to gain: [1] the cost saving from doctor's visits,[2] expensive prescriptions drugs [3] side-effect of steroid products which cause skin thinny, dry and patchy. Good luck

review name: Relieves My Dry, Itchy, Pregnant skin
review text: I love this stuff. My skin gets so dry, it itches. I find the Aveeno Eczema Therapy alot less greasy than Vaseline or Eucerin. It seems to last longer and absorb better than even Cetaphil (I used this for years). I'm currently pregnant and the Aveeno relieves that dry skin itch. I really like how moisturizing it is. It does leave a film on your skin, so putting on anything tight after applying will be a bit difficult but it doesn't rub off on my clothes.

This cream is great. It's extraordinarily rich and creamy, but blends totally into the skin easily. It instantly relieved my super dry skin and softened and soothed the eczema on my palms and arm. It is fragrance free, too; really fragrance free, not just no-added perfumes-but-lingering-chemical-smell fragrance free. I'm happy to have found this.

I have chronic eczema on my face as well as other areas. I have tried so many creams, including expensive prescription creams. Yes, the expensive prescription creams worked, but my insurance doesn't cover them because eczema is a "cosmetic" condition. Steroid cream made the skin on my face red and sensitive, so I am reluctant to use it.

I've used different Aveeno lotions for years with decent results on my eczema, but after discovering this cream... wow. I am amazed. The eczema on my face began to heal almost immediately. After a week of use, the eczema is beginning to clear up.

Granted, it isn't as effective on the eczema on my back, which is much worse and has been there a lot longer. It does relieve the itch and makes the skin softer to the touch, so that makes me happy. Once I started applying the steroid cream at night and the Aveeno lotion in the morning, the results have been much more pronounced.

In short, this stuff is amazing on mild to moderate eczema. As for more severe, I would recommend using it in conjunction with a steroid cream.

Let me just say that when my daughter was born 5 yrs ago I had never even heard of eczema so when she started breaking out in rashes everywhere it scared the crap out of me. I did eventually learn all about eczema but i struggled to find anything to help the flare ups. She got it mostly on her chin, neck, upper back and her armpits. She would scratch until it would bleed. I tried everything until one and nothing seemed to work. I was not a big fan of steroid creams so i really only used that in real extreme cases but in 5 years i've probably only used cortizone twice. I finally found this miracle cream that made it all go away! yay! i agree it's a bit of the expensive side, i buy it at target and while yea it's pricey...to me there is no price when it comes to my baby's comfort. & plus it does seem to last me a while. I am so glad this came along cause i've really tried just about every lotion and cream out there. For anyone suffering from eczema it's worth a try and while I personally don't have eczema, as a mother, it's the worst feeling to see your baby crying about itchy rashes and there's nothing you can do to help. So with that being said i do know how hard eczema is and trying to find the solution. I can't even begin to tell you how much money i've spent and the weird things I would do (blending all natural oatmeal everyday and throwing it in a bath) just to make the eczema go away. I love this lotion!

review name: Nice as lotion, but did not help my eczema
review text:
I love Aveeno products, and based on the reviews here, had high hopes for the Eczema Therapy cream.

This product is a nice, light moisturizer. I will continue to use this tube for my hands as a general moisturizer. Alas, even using daily, it did nothing for the 50-cent-piece sized eczema patch on my wrist that flares up from time to time. Notably, during a flare up, this cream did not provide any relief, the itching was unbearable. I had to switch back to fluocinonide for relief in those instances.

Great with 2 year old eczema. It is a little oily on my hands after using it -- but I just wash my hands, because it seems to work great on her. I wish it came in a bigger container, because we go through this container pretty quickly! I am finding that switching lotions every once in a while is also good for my child; it seems that her body gets immune to the lotion; but switching out seems to do the trick (this is not only with Aveeno - any lotion).

This product is closer to an ointment than a cream. It smooths onto skin and leaves a definite barrier on the surface. It is essentially odor free. By leaving a coating, the skin does get a chance to both heal and be protected from external challenges. The tube dispenses economically and with ease. There is no waste.

review name: great product that helps my daughter
review text: My daughter has had some light Eczema and this is helping keep that away. I'm thankful for anything that helps my kids stay healthy, and this is an easy one that has worked for us. review name: Cured my son's eczema in 3 days flat

No more bleeding, no more patches, no more annoying eczema. I'm honestly amazed. I apply every day, and a little goes a long way. It is a little sticky for about 10 minutes after application. Worth every penny I paid; I just wish this cream was around 3 years ago. My son actually asks for it, now, and his daycare provider is thrilled since she no longer has to monitor him for constant scratching.

Bought it for my husband who gets very cracked and dry hands and feet. The appearance in his hands are very noticeable. Huge improvement. I wouldn't know if it cures it completely but it is a temporary relief. He says he would definitely continue to use it.

Sure fire way to figure it out take an oatmeal bath and see what happens (ok maybe don't go to that extreme but it is always good to know what you are allergic to) because as some people have tried to make very clear in these reviews everyone is different and all products don't work for all people.

review text: I never write reviews but I have to say that I have been suffering for a good couple of months with eye eczema due to the humidity and my low immune system and this really was like a miracle!! I carefully removed the skin with a warm wash cloth and....WHALA!!! Those lines and wrinkles for the most part were non existent!! Yes, I still have those annoying Dennie-Morgan folds which I am hoping will fade with time( or perhaps hyaurolonic acid if I will need it), but they did lighten a great deal which gives me hope. I will continue using this for the rest of my life as a weapon against dry skin and eczema! If you are upset, going crazy, and feel you are never going to get through this eczema nightmare, BUY THIS RIGHT NOW!!!!!!!

review name: Didn't work for my 3 months old...
review text: We got this to try out for our 3 months old since she has Eczema. It had such great reviews online but it just didnt work and actually made it worst. I put this all over her body and face and the next morning it got so bad and it actually made her skin very dry. What i learn is that there isn't a cream that will work for everyone and if your baby has bad eczema, you might need to try a few different creams to see what works... and I should have just put a little bit on her face and body to test it out before putting it all over her. We use Cerave now and it works better.

I used CeraVe instead and liked it much better. Now my son is 6 months. I was out and his back and shoulders were dry and I had the Aveeno cream in my diaper bag so I used that. review name: Hot Water Compress is the most effective therapy for Eczema or any skin problem!
review text: When I applied this product for the first time my eczema became so red, swollen,itchy and it multiplied all over my left leg. I only had few on the knees before I applied Aveeno. I applied Aveeno for two days hoping it would help the problem based from the reviews here but it got worse that's why I decided to stop using it. I treated my skin problem with hot water compress three times a day for 30 mins. After a day of applying very hot compresses, the eczema shrink in size, the redness became pink and it relieved the itchiness. A week after the skin problem cleared up. Aveeno didn't work for me. The added moisture in it aggravated the eczema. If you'll experience redness and swelling, you stop using it.
